11:30.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 1m events at Nottingham (soft; 28-1) and Newcastle (AW; 15-2) produced modest form
runners.name: Del Corso
runners.spotlight: Well-related colt by Dubawi but this autumn's 1m maiden/novice events at Nottingham (soft; 28-1) and Newcastle (AW; 15-2) produced modest form; looks a longer-term proposition, yard second string behind Northern Empire.

runners.comment: Ulysses half-brother to 7f-1m2f winner The African Queen (including 2yo/AW; RPR 86)
runners.name: Felix Gem
runners.spotlight: 11,000gns yearling; second foal; Ulysses half-brother to 7f-1m2f winner The African Queen (including 2yo/AW; RPR 86); dam 1m2f-1m4f winner (89); probably needs to be pretty useful if he's to win this on debut.

runners.comment: 250-1 and raced freely when showing low-level form twice (7f/6f) on AW
runners.name: Fuseboard
runners.spotlight: 250-1 and raced freely when showing low-level form on AW at Kempton (7f) and Wolverhampton (6f).

runners.comment: 325,000gns yearling by Teofilo; top yard has had several winning 2yo newcomers recently
runners.name: Guildmaster
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros foal, 325,000gns yearling by Teofilo; ninth foal; brother to four winners including Guaranteed (7f-1m2f including 2yo Group 3; RPR 109) and Gear Up (7f-1m4f including 2yo Group 1; 114), closely related to 1m1f-1m4f winner New Direction (82); dam maiden (64); one to note from top yard which has had several winning 2yo newcomers recently.

runners.comment: Brother to 9.4f AW winner Jerriais (RPR 66), half-brother to a Jersey hurdle winner
runners.name: Jerseygeordie
runners.spotlight: By Geordieland; sixth foal; brother to 9.4f AW winner Jerriais (RPR 66), half-brother to Jersey 2m1f hurdle winner Jersey Jack; dam Jersey 7f-8.5f winner; newcomer, not as striking on paper as some of these.

runners.comment: 80-1 at Kempton (1m, AW) and steadily dropped out once the race began in earnest
runners.name: Level Look
runners.spotlight: From a leading yard but he was 80-1 for a novice at Kempton (1m, AW) three weeks ago and steadily dropped out once the race began in earnest; looks one for a later stage.

runners.comment: Modest form twice at Kempton (7f, AW); left Kevin Philippart de Foy since for 15,000gns
runners.name: Lux Aeterna
runners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two 7f novice/maiden events at Kempton (AW) over ten weeks ago; has since left Kevin Philippart de Foy for 15,000gns at the end of October; probably best watched for now.

runners.comment: Third start this month; it's likely to be in handicaps next year that he comes good
runners.name: Mountbatten
runners.spotlight: Never-dangerous outsider this month when beaten 16l at Kempton and 26l at Southwell (again 7f on AW) 11 days later; it's likely to be in handicaps next year that he comes good.

runners.comment: 220,000euros yearling; 12-1, made most when 4th of 12 at Kempton (7f, AW) three weeks ago
runners.name: Northern Empire
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling by Night Of Thunder; 12-1, made most when about 7l fourth of 12 in novice at Kempton (7f, AW) three weeks ago; major role looks on its way, with improvement highly likely.

runners.comment: By Aclaim; probably best watched on debut
runners.name: Serragasso
runners.spotlight: By Aclaim; fourth foal; unraced dam half-sister to winners Heron (1m6f), Own Agenda (US 8.5f, including turf) and Ashwa Parth (Indian 6f-1m), out of useful French 1m winner; probably best watched on debut.

runners.comment: 5-2 at Southwell (7f, AW) last month when no match for the winner but beating the other 12
runners.name: The Stone Power
runners.spotlight: By Kingman; first foal of 7f-1m2f winner (including Group 2; RPR 115); 5-2 for novice at Southwell (7f, AW) last month when no match for the impressive winner but beating the other 12, always prominent and keeping on stoutly despite hanging left; drawn wide today but he's one of the few to consider seriously.

runners.comment: Modest form both starts (7f, AW); made most last time and a hood is now fitted
runners.name: Buckland Belle
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10l at Chelmsford and Kempton (again 7f on AW) 13 days later, showing modest form; made most last time and a hood is now fitted.

12:00.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: 1lb below last winning mark, but not at his best lately; others look safer
runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has dropped 1lb lower than when completing a hat-trick on Tapeta in March; has run well here, but not at his best lately and the return to Class 4 company made little difference at Wolverhampton last time; others look safer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a revelation through the winter and I was really proud of the way he fought back when two horses went by him at Lingfield on Friday. He's won eight races now and he's not finished yet. 22-04-25

runners.comment: 3lb higher than Newcastle win last time; may find this an insufficient stamina test
runners.name: Knockbrex

quotes.race: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Knockbrex was drawn well and got a lovely trip round. I probably hit the front a little bit sooner than I thought he would but he picked them off pretty quickly and when the other horse came to me, he picked up again - Jack Callan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won over 1m4f here in January and narrowly made a successful return from 207 days off at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) last month; up 3lb but a greater concern is whether he will find this a sufficient stamina test.

runners.comment: Gelded since a disappointing handicap debut at Kempton; has a bit to prove
runners.name: Port Of London
runners.spotlight: Showed good form in a couple of AW novices in September, winning narrowly at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) on the second occasion, but disappointed on handicap debut there (1m3f; first-time cheekpieces) the following month; gelded since but still has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Course winner whose latest Kempton second has been franked; should stay this far
runners.name: Gilet
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f maiden here as a 2yo; runner-up four times from ten starts since, the latest when beaten a length at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) 19 days ago (winner has gone in again since); has never attempted this far before but there is stamina in his pedigree; respected from just 1lb higher.

runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 121; still just 1lb higher than when last successful; high on list
runners.name: Hitched

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Vase Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Hitched has been a model of consistency all winter. That's his 15th run of the campaign, so he's pretty admirable, and I was delighted he was able to top it off with his best performance. Lingfield suits him best, it's just unfortunate there weren't many races there that fitted him. He probably should have been All-Weather Horse of the Year if I hadn't messed the last few runs up, but he's been a superstar. He's very sound with a great mind and he's a joy to train - David Simcock, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner who has run well to be placed behind the same horse at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last two outings; record over C&D reads 121 and he's still just 1lb higher than when last successful; high on list.

runners.comment: Completed a hat-trick on Tapeta in January but well held on last month's Newcastle return
runners.name: Joolianoss

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Joolianoss has had a few niggles and that's why he's been lightly raced. He's nicely bred and it looks as though he could be alright. We may well mind him now and look to go on the turf at some stage - James Evans, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick on Tapeta (1m/1m2f) in January but went missing for 300 days before well held at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) last month; needs to have come on from that.

runners.comment: Returns from another three months off but still unexposed; the drop back in trip may help
runners.name: Shrimp Shady
runners.spotlight: Showed fair form in maiden/novice company, winning at Windsor (1m, good to firm) as a 2yo; did too much early when well held on his handicap debut at Newmarket (1m, good) in September; returns from another three months off but still unexposed and this dropping back in trip may help.

runners.comment: Modest over hurdles last time but had won his last two starts on Flat turf prior to that
runners.name: Annexation

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late S F Hui

quotes.race: PricedUp.Bet Grassroots Series Middle Distance Final Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Annexation won nicely at Bath on Tuesday and got a bit of confidence, so it's a great performance from him today. It's a great prize and a good bit of placing! He's come without a penalty, unfortunately the boy who won on him the other day (Matthew Lloyd Slater) couldn't do the weight so Jack rode him - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Annexation missed the beat a bit and it was ideal as I had something to aim at the whole way. I think this is his ideal trip and he could win another one up here - Chris Hayes, rider

runners.spotlight: Dual Dundalk winner (1m, Polytrack) who failed to sparkle back over hurdles last time but had won his last two starts on Flat turf (1m2f) prior to that; not dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: He was really good at Navan in his maiden hurdle and we were aiming for the novice hurdle at Tipperary but he wasn't right. He seems in good form again and we might aim him at the For Auction Novice Hurdle at Navan. He handled soft ground on the Flat, although whether he'll be as effective on it over hurdles we'll see. We'll feel our way with him in the autumn and if he handles soft ground we can plot our way through the winter with him. 09-11-20

runners.comment: 2lb lower than for both wins this year but needs a resurgence
runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than for both wins this year, including at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) in April, but for good reason in view of his recent efforts; needs a resurgence.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

runners.comment: Five wins here but 1m4f looks his best trip on this surface these days
runners.name: Party Island
runners.spotlight: Has run well to finish runner-up on his last two visits here but they were over 1m4f, as were his last four wins at this track; will need a solid pace over this trip.

12:30.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Hasn't built on a promising return at Wolverhampton in September; doubts remain; hood on
runners.name: Brakeman
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when only just beaten on his Wolverhampton return (6f, Tapeta) in September after over a year off, but has disappointed in both outings there (5f/6f) since; hood is now added to the usual tongue-tie on this switch to Polytrack and this isn't a strong race, but doubts remain.

runners.comment: Has beaten a total of one rival in two starts;  may do better once handicapped
runners.name: Celtic Spirit
runners.spotlight: Has beaten a total of one rival in two starts, firstly over C&D in October and then at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) last month; may do better once handicapped.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two AW novices; modest handicaps beckon
runners.name: Lowestoft
runners.spotlight: Astronomical prices when beaten a long way in 1m novices at Southwell (Tapeta) and Chelmsford (Polytrack); modest handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: Fifth in both starts; hung right last time which would be a concern on this track
runners.name: Special Acclaim
runners.spotlight: Fifth in both starts 243 days apart, showing some ability on his Chelmsford debut (6f, Polytrack) in March but taking a step backwards at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month; hung right on the bend last time which would be a concern on this track.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two of his eight starts, including over C&D; high on the list in this company
runners.name: Tokyo Joe
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of his eight starts, the latest when beaten half a length in a five-runner novice over C&D this month; more exposed than most but still high on the list in this company.

runners.comment: Stable has its fair share of winning 2yo newcomers and market support would be significant
runners.name: Eternity
runners.spotlight: March foal by Invincible Army; dam placed at 5f/6f (including 2yo/AW; RPR 71), sister to 7f Listed winner Eternally, out of 6f-winning half-sister to 6f Listed winner/good broodmare Irresistible; stable has its fair share of winning 2yo newcomers and market support would be significant.

runners.comment: Some ability on Salisbury debut in May; half-sister to four-time 6f Polytrack winner Drama
runners.name: Soviet Symphony
runners.spotlight: 16-1 but showed some ability when fourth of five finishers on Salisbury debut (6f, good to firm) in May; half-sister to the four-time 6f Polytrack winner Drama (RPR 101); interesting, especially if market positive.

runners.comment: 0-10; second at Chelmsford on Thursday; this comes pretty soon afterwards, but in the mix
runners.name: Thecoffeepoddotco
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; seven months off before beaten a length into second of five in a Chelmsford novice (5f, Polytrack) on Thursday; that form puts her in the mix, albeit with this race coming pretty soon afterwards.

13:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Return to this trip should suit and is 1-1 in Class 5 handicaps on the AW; respected
runners.name: Giorgio M
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 16, but he ran well to finish third of ten on his stable debut/reappearance over 6f here a fortnight ago; return to this trip should suit, while he is 1-1 in Class 5 handicaps on the AW; respected.

runners.comment: 1lb above his last winning mark and drops to this level for the first time since January
runners.name: Rey De La Batalla
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come over C&D; not at his best last time, but is just 1lb above his last winning mark and drops to this level for the first time since January; shortlisted.

runners.comment: All five AW wins have come over C&D and is back off last winning mark; could go well
runners.name: Tadreeb

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb is obviously in very good form and we've been very lucky to inherit him, as he's a very nice horse. He's got very good back form and was quite classy in his day. Michael [Attwater, previous trainer] did very well with him, but sometimes a change of yard can just perk them up again. We'll be looking at running him here next week - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb has to be ridden like that and it was a muddling pace. I think the plan is to run him on Good Friday if the handicapper allows. He could be a nice type for the turf - William Carson, rider.

runners.spotlight: All five AW wins have come over C&D and is back off the same mark as when completing a hat-trick here in January; creditable fourth of 12 after blowing the start here (1m) and no surprise if he goes well back from a 69-day break.

stable_tour.quote: He was a nice horse for Mark Johnston. I train for Canisbay, who have a lot of horses based at Epsom but some with me as well. Michael Attwater had a really good time with Tadreeb but then he lost his form a little bit and the owner decided he wanted to see if a change of scenery would do him good. We haven't got the gallops and facilities of Epsom - we're a small family-run business and have our own gallops - but sometimes these horses appreciate a bit of an easier regime. We gave him a nice rest through last summer and he won his first few races when we brought him back in January. Unfortunately, he pulled a muscle, which is why he's missed a bit of the season, but he's come back in good form. He's seven now, so he isn't going to get any better, but he's won three and been placed several times this year. He should give us fun through the winter. 27-08-25

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Cotton / Mrs Suzanne Conway
runners.comment: C&D winner; poor effort last time and the widest stall leave him with something to prove
runners.name: Dream Of Mischief

prev_owners.owner: Mrs F Cotton, Mr & Mrs P Conway

runners.spotlight: C&D winner as a 2yo and back to form when successful at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) in October, but a poor effort there 12 days later and the widest stall here leave him with something to prove.

runners.comment: Off the same mark as when winning this race last year; another big run expected
runners.name: Ernies Valentine
runners.spotlight: Two narrow wins at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) and Wolverhampton (8.6f; Tapeta) in the autumn; still 3lb higher than for the latest, but is off the same mark as when winning this race last year; record under Phoebe Edwards reads 1321; another big run expected.

stable_tour.quote: He won really nicely three starts ago at Kempton and then got a bad draw back there the next time. He ran well at Carlisle last week, looking the winner a furlong out. He probably wants to come back to 7f on a stiff track on turf. He just wants good ground and it was a little fast for him at Carlisle. He's consistent and will win a few more races this season. 30-05-24

runners.comment: All eight wins have come over 6f and is still 4lb higher than when last successful
runners.name: Havana Sky
runners.spotlight: Possible to forgive his latest performance and he has gone close a couple of times over this trip, but all eight wins have come over 6f and is still 4lb higher than when last successful; no headgear today.

stable_tour.quote: He was my all-weather winter horse. He won six races last year but then got an injury. He won horse of the month in December, getting a rather nice bonus, and had a two-month holiday after January. He's just started back in cantering and I'm looking forward to seeing him back on the turf. He's a 6f/7f horse and is owned by a great group of people who love him. 30-04-25

runners.comment: 0-11; disappointing favourite at Kempton 12 days ago; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Tenbob Tommy
runners.spotlight: 0-11; runner-up in three consecutive starts on turf/Polytrack in the autumn, but proved a disappointing favourite at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) 12 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: 3lb above last winning mark, but could make his presence felt given an uncontested lead
runners.name: H Key Lails
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who made all from the outside stall over 1m here last month; fourth of ten off this mark over the same trip a fortnight ago, but could make his presence felt if enjoying an uncontested lead.

runners.comment: Becoming favourably handicapped, but is still to prove he wants this far
runners.name: Diamond Dreamer
runners.spotlight: 5-21 on the AW including two wins here (5f/6f); becoming favourably handicapped, but is still to prove he wants this far.

runners.comment: Beaten a head on latest AW start and could go well if ready to roll after three months off
runners.name: Serenity Dream
runners.spotlight: Down to 6f for the first time when winning at Goodwood (good) in August, but twice held over the same trip afterwards; 3lb higher than when beaten a head on his last AW start at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) in May and could go well if ready to roll after three months off.

runners.comment: 0-10 in turf in Ireland and well held on stable/AW debut here a fortnight ago
runners.name: Manhattan Chute
runners.owner: J May, R L Field, W Trenchard, J Pook
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in turf in Ireland and well held on stable/AW debut here (6f) a fortnight ago (Giorgio M third); best watched for now.

runners.comment: Dual 7f winner last year, but modest last time and needs to bounce back
runners.name: Liberty Bird
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f on turf/Tapeta for Charlie Johnston last year and only beaten a neck at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in October; well held in her only start for Alice Haynes at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month and needs to bounce back now starting out for another new yard.

runners.comment: C&D winner just 1lb higher than when last successful; solid claims back in a 0-65
runners.name: Level Up
runners.spotlight: Can be a bit in-and-out, but he has winning form over C&D and is just 1lb higher than when successful at Chelmsford (5f, Polytrack) in October; solid claims back in a 0-65.

runners.comment: Three wins this year, but there has to be a question mark against her over this sharp 5f
runners.name: Lahina Bay
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, but came up short in her hat-trick bid when fifth of ten here (6f) 19 days ago; back down 2lb, but there has to be a question mark against her over this sharp 5f.

runners.comment: Has shown little in five starts since returning for this yard in May
runners.name: Desdemona
runners.spotlight: Turf winner here (5f, good to firm) for Tom Clover in July last year, but has shown little in five starts since returning for this yard in May; another 3lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.comment: His blistering early pace could be a real asset on his first visit here
runners.name: Sams Xpress

quotes.race: Happy St Patrick's Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Sam's Xpress has loads of boot, piles of boot. He showed a nice bit last year but had a bit of trouble with sore shins and that. He could turn out next week in a three-year-old only handicap at Naas - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Did well after joining this yard in the summer, winning at Chelmsford (5f, Polytrack) in August and at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) in October; held back there last time, but his blistering early pace could be a real asset on his first visit here.

runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Has regressed since winning two Tapeta novices this time last year; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Captain Kinsella

prev_owners.owner: Optimumracing Co Uk & Andrew P Bell

runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has regressed since winning a couple of 5f Tapeta novices this time last year; down another 3lb and cheekpieces are given a go, but still has enough to prove and is unlikely to be able to dominate this field.

runners.comment: 0-13; down another 2lb but others still appeal more
runners.name: Rajeteriat
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when fifth of ten over C&D last month, but that took his record to 0-13; down another 2lb, but others still appeal more.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fun 5f sprinter who finished in mid-division at Lingfield on Tuesday. He's taken a while to click but I think he's on a mark where we can hopefully have a bit more action now. 01-12-25

runners.comment: 13lb lower than for sole success over C&D in April, but hasn't shown much lately
runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 21 starts came over C&D from 13lb higher in April when trained by Richard Hannon, but she hasn't shown much lately including in two starts for this yard; best watched for now.

14:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Won at Southwell on Friday; 5lb penalty on a sharper track, but more compelling than most
runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg & Mrs Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith
Westerberg & Mrs Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith

runners.spotlight: Doubled his winning tally on his 30th outing at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) on Friday; 5lb penalty and sharper test pose questions, but he still holds more compelling claims than most.

runners.comment: Off nine months; 5lb lower than when winning over C&D in September last year; watch market
runners.name: Global Warning

quotes.race: sunracing.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Global Warning won well, I was very pleased with him. He's an improving horse, still young and on his first time against the older horses but he showed me something I like to see - when they picked up at the two and a half, he stretched all the way to the line - Gerald Mosse, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Not the most prolific these days and has been off for nine months, but he is 5lb lower than when winning over C&D in September last year; market support would be significant.

runners.comment: Only beaten a head over C&D last Wednesday and much respected from the same mark
runners.name: My Boy Harry
runners.spotlight: Both wins this year, the latest at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in October; only beaten a head over C&D last Wednesday and much respected from the same mark.

runners.comment: Mixed bag in three starts since returning for this yard in October and others appeal more
runners.name: Amarachi
runners.spotlight: Narrowly made a successful handicap debut at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) in June when with Conrad Allen; a bit of a mixed bag in three starts since returning for this yard in October and others appeal more.

runners.comment: Ran with credit here a week ago, but is an infrequent winner and looks best over shorter
runners.name: Roman Emperor
runners.spotlight: Landed a 0-50 classified event at Yarmouth (6f, good) in June and did well to finish as close as he did when fourth of nine here (6f) a week ago, but is an infrequent winner and looks best over shorter.

runners.comment: Off same mark as when winning over C&D in August, but that is his only win in 23 starts
runners.name: Zaltalla

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a great ride from Tommie [Jakes]. He's one of the most underused claimers, which I don't want to say too many times as he's still got a few left of his 5lb claim and I want to use them all. He should be getting a lot more rides. Zaltalla is awkward, but he got him into a great spot and kicked at the right time. His agent was pushing me to use him, but I sort of resisted. After a while we gave him a go and things have not stopped going right since we did - Michael Attwater, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Not at his best lately, but is back off the same mark as when winning over C&D in August; that is his only success in 23 starts, though, so there are risks attached.

runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton earlier in month and fourth from a poor draw at Kempton; major player
runners.name: Homme De Fer
runners.spotlight: Has a good record on the AW (442314), the win coming at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) at the start of the month; ran well to finish fourth of 12 under his penalty at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) nine days later, especially as he was drawn in stall 13; back down 1lb; major player.

runners.comment: 2-33 but record over C&D reads 213; not dismissed
runners.name: Buttercross Flyer
runners.spotlight: 2-33, her latest win coming in a 0-50 classified event here in August; met trouble when well held at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last time, but not dismissed back over this C&D (record 213).

runners.comment: 1-22; hasn't looked like winning again lately including when stepped up to 7f last time
runners.name: Little Miss Magic
runners.spotlight: 6lb lower than when beaten a head at Bath (5.7f, firm) in August, but 1-22 and hasn't looked like doubling her tally of late, including when stepped up to this trip at Chelmsford last time.

runners.comment: Shock winner in September last year, but nowhere near that form since; AW debut
runners.name: Liricist

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Liricist was given a ridiculous handicap mark by the handicapper. I thought he was a 55 [rated] horse and they gave him 32, which was a bit of an embarrassment. I was half expecting him to run well, but at the same time, the word from the George Boughey yard was that the favourite is a 75 [rated] horse. We've had very few runners this year and we've got quite a few two-year-olds who aren't quite ready to run. He's a homebred by the owners, Joli Racing, who I've trained for over many years. They sell them at the sales, but if they don't get what they want, they send them to me. It's a welcome winner and a winner with a two-year-old for a long-term owner is brilliant - Tony Newcombe, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Shock 66-1 winner on her nursery debut at Chepstow (7f, good to firm) in Sepember last year, but nowhere near that form in just three outings since; needs the swtich to the AW to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Returns from seven months and has the outside stall; blinkers on; watch market
runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten many on his four starts, including on handicap debut at Ripon (6f, good to soft) in May; returns from seven months off in first-time blinkers and has the outside stall; probably only of interest if backed.

runners.comment: Placed just once in 21 starts and nothing recently to suggest that is about to change
runners.name: Tilsworth Max
runners.spotlight: Placed just once in 21 starts under rules and nothing recently to suggest that is about to change.

14:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Drops into a 0-55 for the first time but record of 0-27 on the AW sounds a note of caution
runners.name: Dion Baker
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who continues to slide down the weights and drops into a 0-55 for the first time; may not face much pace pressure, but a record of 0-27 on the AW sounds a note of caution; blinkers return.

runners.comment: Not threatening lately and last on only previous attempt at 7f; new headgear combination
runners.name: Horus
runners.spotlight: 8lb lower than when gaining his only win here (6f) just under a year ago, but not threatening lately and failed to beat a rival on his only previous attempt over this far; needs a transformation in the new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Four-time winner on the AW, but off 140 days and record fresh is far from compelling
runners.name: So Chic

prev_owners.owner: Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward
Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward

runners.spotlight: All four wins have come on the AW, the latest here (1m) in August; that's fair form, but she has been off for 140 days since and her record fresh is far from compelling.

runners.comment: Both wins over 1m here, but not sure dropping a furlong is the answer
runners.name: Raqraaq
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 1m here and is 5lb lower than for the latest in January; has suggested a couple of times since then that a resurgence may be forthcoming, but not sure dropping a furlong is the answer.

runners.comment: Dropping back to 7f may help, but a record of 1-32 poses a question
runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.spotlight: 11lb lower than when a close second of ten over C&D in June and dropping back to 7f may help given how hard he pulled over 1m here a fortnight ago, but a record of 1-32 poses a question.

runners.comment: Inconsistent of late; hard to know what to expect
runners.name: Chloes Courage
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent of late, winning in first-time blinkers at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) at the start of the month, but failing to beat a rival over C&D last Wednesday; hard to know what to expect.

runners.comment: Out of the frame in 12 starts since successful handicap debut, but he was backed last time
runners.name: Sedgemoor
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in all 12 starts since his successful handicap debut for Richard Hannon at Haydock (7f, good) in June last year; however, he met trouble at Wolverhampton three weeks ago having attracted market support, so is worth monitoring in the betting again.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all eight starts including four for this yard; hard to recommend
runners.name: Duke Orsino
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts including four for this yard; hard to recommend despite another 4lb drop.

runners.comment: Returned to winning form over 6f at Kempton last Wednesday; return to this trip no problem
runners.name: Vitalline
runners.spotlight: Had been shaping as though he was ready to strike again and everything fell right for him at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) last Wednesday; has a 4lb penalty and the outside draw, but still respected with the step back up in trip no problem (dual C&D winner).

runners.comment: Ran well when third at Chelmsford last month; stays this far; respected off the same mark
runners.name: Colorada Dancer
runners.spotlight: Yet to win a handicap, but he ran well to finish third of 12 at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack; first-time cheekpieces) last month (winner has gone in again since); does stay this far and respected off the same mark.

runners.comment: 0-14 since his successful nursery debut at Wolverhampton in November last year
runners.name: Arlecchinos Rex
runners.spotlight: 0-14 since his successful nursery debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in November last year and he needs to put a modest effort there three weeks ago behind him.

runners.comment: Needs to fare better than on his recent starts if he is to regain winning form
runners.name: Sisters In The Sky
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f on Polytrack early on as a 4yo, but is best known as a sprinter these days; needs to fare better than on his recent starts if he is to regain winning form in any case.

15:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: Five wins here; pulled too hard last time but respected if settling better down in class
runners.name: Nordic Glory

quotes.race: Play Coral Racing-Super-Series For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Nordic Glory was down in class and deserved to win. He just needed a bit of luck from a wide draw - Michael Attwater, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five-time winner over 5f/6f here, but pulled his chance away over C&D a week ago; respected if settling better now back in a 0-55 for the first time since winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) in September.

runners.comment: Is proving consistent, but is now 0-18; others more compelling
runners.name: I Can Imagine
runners.spotlight: Is proving consistent, especially since returned to the AW last month, but her mark remains static as a result and she is now 0-18; others more compelling.

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Well held in five starts; needs the return to this trip to make a difference; hood on
runners.name: Henry Tudor
runners.spotlight: Well held in five starts, the last two in handicaps over 5f here including when behind two of these a week ago; needs the addition of a hood and return to this trip to make a difference.

runners.comment: Last two wins have come over C&D from marks in the low 60s; very much respected
runners.name: Watermelon Sugar
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 112, the two wins coming off marks in the low 60s; caught the eye when a running-on fifth of nine at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) a fortnight ago and very much respected.

runners.comment: Met trouble when keeping on at Wolverhampton last time; 2lb below last winning mark
runners.name: Hannahs Return
runners.spotlight: Won four times last year including over C&D; was having her second start back from a year off when fifth of 13 at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month, meeting trouble when attempting to close; 2lb below her last winning mark and could go well granted more luck.

runners.comment: 2lb below last winning mark, but out of the frame in five previous attempts at 6f
runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta); 2lb lower than for the most recent, but has finished out of the frame in five previous attempts at 6f.

stable_tour.quote: She was super impressive first time out at Wolverhampton. I was kicking myself after Bath as I shouldn't have run her there with a penalty and the track probably didn't suit her. The form of that race is unbelievable, though, as the winner [Betty Clover] has gone on to win the Marygate and the second [Englemere] has won twice since quite comfortably. She's a very honest filly who tries very hard, and just tries to do a little too much in the first half of a race. She was very good when second in the Lily Agnes as it looked a nice race. She's owned by a local guy from Wrexham, so she'll probably be campaigned around Chester and she looks tailormade for it. Six furlongs won't be a problem and there'll be plenty more days for her. The more experience she gets, the more she'll be able to mix it on different tracks. She could be one for the St Hugh Stakes at Newbury later on and she looks capable of picking up black type. 30-05-24

runners.comment: 1-24; didn't get home over C&D a week ago and races off the same mark
runners.name: Mammy
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; record stands at 1-24, the win coming off 9lb higher at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) in January when trained by Michael Bell; placed a few times since, but she didn't get home over C&D a week ago and races off the same mark; stable also runs Beau Jardine.

runners.comment: Did well to go so close after again blowing the start here a week ago; just 1-30; risky
runners.name: Its Showtime
runners.spotlight: Did well to go down by just a neck over 5f here a week ago after blowing the start, but that's a familiar story with her (refused to race once); races off the same mark, but wouldn't be sure to back up that effort and her career record stands at 1-30 (0-18 on the AW).

runners.comment: Looks fairly treated at present, but a losing run of 23 does raise questions
runners.name: Beau Jardine
runners.spotlight: Hasn't run at all badly lately and is on a fair mark based on a couple of placed efforts at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) in the autumn; a losing run of 23 does raise questions.

runners.comment: Heavy defeats in three previous attempts at 6f are a cause for concern
runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.spotlight: Made it ninth-time lucky at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) in October and not beaten far when sixth of ten here (5f) a week ago (It's Showtime second); heavy defeats in three previous attempts at 6f are a cause for concern, though.

runners.comment: Unplaced in last 15 starts since and was completely tailed off at Kempton last Wednesday
runners.name: World Of Darcy

quotes.race: Trustatrader Apply Today EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I took a bit of a gamble and ran World Of Darcy at Newmarket over seven furlongs because I felt that now's the time to decide what we're going to do with him. Luke [Morris, jockey] said drop him back to six and get him a bit of confidence because he's obviously had a few hard days at work and we picked this one. There's nothing wrong with him, but he's not very big. There's always going to be a doubt whether this horse trains on, but at the moment he eats well and works well. There's a winter campaign and I think that's what I'm aiming for. We've got a big entry at the weekend, but we'll look at that and decide what the ground does. We'll see how he recovers and then we'll make decisions - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto National Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: World Of Darcy is a good solid horse, he'll be winning plenty of races. He'll probably go for the Windsor Castle - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Northern Commercials - Used Stock For Quick Delivery EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed. World Of Darcy travelled really sweetly and I could have done with a lead for longer. Karl said whatever he did today that he would improve a lot for it - Sam James, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 21lb lower than when completing a hat-trick over 6f on turf in October last year, but unplaced in all 15 starts since and was completely tailed off at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) last Wednesday.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Elite Status, who's a very good horse, in the National Stakes and will definitely go for the Windsor Castle, barring accidents. He's tough and solid and the stiff five furlongs will play to his strengths. He'll go there with a chance. 14-06-23

runners.comment: Can put in a big effort from time to time, but far from solid and drawn widest
runners.name: Tilsworth Turf

quotes.race: Carling Handicap
quotes.quote: I've missed this feeling big time. John said Tilsworth Turf had a chance - you can't quite believe it when he's 125-1 - but he was right. I'm feeling the best I ever have. I've done lots of work on my back and feel privileged to be back in the saddle - Edward Greatrex, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Can put in a big effort from time to time, winning at Leicester (6f, soft; 125-1) in April last year and finishing third of ten at Southwell (5f, Tapeta; 100-1) in October; far from solid, though, and drawn widest.

15:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Three course wins and third over C&D a fortnight ago; considered from the same mark
runners.name: Enough Already

quotes.race: Quinnbet Quaterback Handicap
quotes.quote: There was no pace on early but Enough Already travelled the best throughout but I didn't want to get there too early - Ray Dawson, rider.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Enough Already was a nice animal and lost his way a little bit, but the last day at Kempton he showed a bit of spark to finish fourth. I said to Lee if this horse runs his race he shouldn't be far away and we followed Ryan all the way. It took him a little while to get going but once he got motoring he was away - Dougie Costello, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won three times here (1m/1m2f) before his spell in Ireland and showed the ability remains when third of ten over C&D a fortnight ago; considered if stepping forward again from the same mark.

runners.comment: AW form since winning on Polytrack early last year reads 980965506
runners.name: Ocean Heights

quotes.race: Betfred 'Supporting Macmillan' Handicap
quotes.quote: It was really good, Ocean Heights is a lovely horse. He escaped the penalty and although it was a little shorter, it was no problem for him. He got a nice easy lead and it worked out well - Jack Dace, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 2lb below his last winning mark, but his AW form since winning on Polytrack early last year reads 980965506; others look more solid.

runners.comment: 0-8; changed hands for 37,000gns this month and needs to improve on stable debut
runners.name: Fool Again
runners.spotlight: 0-8 for Charlie Fellowes; not beaten so far at Kempton (1m3f, Polytrack) three weeks ago, but was still only fourth of five; changed hands for 37,000gns this month and needs to improve on stable debut.

runners.comment: 0-6; regressed in his last four starts; plenty to prove down in trip on Polytrack debut
runners.name: Si Solus
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in his first two starts on the Southwell Tapeta (1m4f/1m3f) but has regressed in his last four starts, including three handicaps; plenty to prove down in trip on Polytrack debut.

runners.breeder: J Hanly, A Stroud & Skymarc Farm
runners.comment: Back off his last winning mark, but something to prove back from another break
runners.name: Crafter
runners.spotlight: Back off the same mark as when winning over C&D just over a year ago, but well held on his return from 137 days off in an amateur riders' event at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) in October and has been absent for another 11 weeks since; others preferred.

runners.comment: Only beaten a neck by a subsequent winner over C&D last month; open to further progress
runners.name: Bintazzo
runners.spotlight: 0-6, but was only beaten a neck having been given a positive ride over C&D (first-time blinkers) last month; up 2lb, but the winner has gone in again since and she remains open to further progress; respected.

runners.comment: 0-6, but the longer trip should suit on breeding; hood on
runners.name: Mullwarchar
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has shown ability, as when fourth of nine at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) nine days ago; needs a bit more, but the longer trip should suit on breeding and a hood is now given a go.

runners.comment: 0-8; some encouragement in her pedigree for this first venture beyond 7f, but not solid
runners.name: Sands Of Havana
runners.spotlight: Only just beaten on her 2yo debut for Ollie Sangster, but hasn't gone on from it and now 0-8 including two starts for this yard; some encouragement in her pedigree for this first venture beyond 7f, but not solid.

runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick under a 5lb penalty, but latest C&D win has already been franked
runners.name: Tommys Promise
runners.spotlight: Winless in his first 14 starts under rules, but now bids for a hat-trick after wins at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) and under Donagh Murphy over C&D (third has won since) this month; has a 5lb penalty to carry, but still high on the list in his current mood.

runners.comment: Won two 0-50 classified events on turf in June, but others more persuasive back on AW
runners.name: Banksman
runners.spotlight: Didn't really take to hurdling in four attempts after joining this yard; won two 0-50 classified events at around 1m on turf in June, but others more persuasive on this second AW outing.

12:20.race_name: pricedup.bet Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Mares' Novices' Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.breeder: Elevage Du Colombier, Haras De Saint-Voi
runners.comment: Got off the mark over hurdles with a minimum of fuss at Uttoxeter last month.
runners.name: Khrisma

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Mares' Nov' Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We were only hacking around. Khrisma was very professional, she's grown up so much in the last year or so and she's really come on for that race at Punchestown - Nico De Boinville, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won two Grade 3 bumpers over 1m4f on soft in France and showed useful form when placed in 2m novice events this year; got off the mark over hurdles with a minimum of fuss at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last month and even with a 7lb penalty she sets the standard here.

stable_tour.quote: I like her and she has had some solid AQPS Flat form in France. She needed to learn to settle last season but, amazingly for a horse who pulled so hard at home, she was great on the racecourse when she finished third at Windsor and second at Punchestown. She travelled into the race in Ireland like a good horse and got beaten by a hotpot. She's still a novice over hurdles and she's well educated. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Pulled up on her hurdles debut at Wincanton 18 days ago and has questions to answer.
runners.name: Annie Hathaway
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when second to a shorter-priced stablemate in a bumper at Warwick last November but ran below that form subsequently in two similar contests; pulled up on her hurdles debut at Wincanton 18 days ago and has questions to answer.

stable_tour.quote: "She was in training last spring but got a bit weak so she didn't run and had a good break with her owners. She's progressing well now and although she's schooled pleasingly she'll probably start in a bumper. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Second in a 3m Irish point in March but beaten 40l and 30l in two runs over hurdles.
runners.name: Beep Beep Becky
runners.spotlight: Second in a 3m Irish point in March but beaten 40l and 30l in two runs over hurdles and may need more time.

runners.comment: Didn't fair too badly when fifth over C&D 15 days ago following a two-year absence.
runners.name: Ever Ready
runners.spotlight: Has managed only five runs (debut in March 2023) but didn't fair too badly when fifth of nine finishers over C&D (soft) 15 days ago following a two-year absence; holds place claims if she can build on that latest run.

runners.comment: Raced too freely when taking a tired fall on her British debut; still a nice prospect
runners.name: First Candidate
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point over 3m in February but raced too freely when taking a tired fall at the last on her British debut at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft) in October; first-time tongue-tie goes on and she steps down in trip; still a nice prospect and in good hands.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely mare, she's an Irish point-to-point winner who went straight over hurdles at Stratford, but she got it all wrong that day, ran way too keen in front and fell at the last. Luckily she's fine but we'll put things on hold a little bit, come back to two miles, and down the line I'm sure she's going to make a nice horse. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Sixth in a couple of bumpers this term; makes hurdles debut.
runners.name: Hey Flint
runners.spotlight: Sixth in a couple of bumpers this term; makes hurdles debut but may be seen in a better light when she steps up in distance.

runners.comment: Made an encouraging debut over hurdles when third to a hotpot at Warwick last month.
runners.name: Jems Lilly
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a couple of Irish bumpers last term and made an encouraging debut over hurdles when third to a hotpot at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) last month; steps back in trip and should run well.

stable_tour.quote: We've got her from Elizabeth Lalor, for whom she showed promise in two bumpers. She's a nice mare to go hurdling with. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Definite signs of promise in a couple of bumpers; hurdles debut.
runners.name: Kittys Glance
runners.spotlight: Definite signs of promise in a couple of bumpers; trainer knows the family well having trained the dam and other relatives and this filly looks sure to be primed for today's hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Runner-up in an Irish point in April but well beaten on both starts over hurdles.
runners.name: Mild Magic
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point in April (3m, good/yielding) but has yet to transfer that ability to hurdles having been well beaten on both starts; looks one for further down the road.

runners.comment: Third on her hurdles debut in a claimer at Ludlow 19 days ago.
runners.name: Miracles Do Happen
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability in bumpers despite a tendency to hang to the right; did the same on the run-in when third on hurdles debut in a claimer at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) 19 days ago and this looks a tougher assignment.

runners.comment: Showed promise when third in a couple of bumpers in April and May 2024 but off since.
runners.name: Moorsbrook
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when third in a couple of bumpers in April and May 2024 but off since; probably best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Raced too freely when fifth behind Khrisma on hurdles debut at Uttoxeter last month.
runners.name: Neeps And Tatties
runners.owner: Dalziel Family, K Rogers, D Vowles
runners.spotlight: Raced too freely when fifth behind Khrisma on hurdles debut at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last month; first-time hood now on, but seemingly held.

runners.comment: Beaten 29l when tenth of 13 on her debut in a bumper at Warwick last month.
runners.name: Rose Of The Shires
runners.spotlight: Beaten 29l when tenth of 13 on debut in a bumper at Warwick (2m, good to soft; 33-1) last month; makes hurdles debut but may need more time.

runners.comment: Won on third bumper start and good second last time; hurdling debut.
runners.name: Shotgun Shirley
runners.spotlight: Big step forward when winning at Uttoxeter (good; first-time hood) in October on third bumper start and she lost nothing in defeat when runner-up in a Listed mares' race at Cheltenham (soft) since; yard won a hatful of races with siblings; can go on to better things now hurdling.

stable_tour.quote: She won a bumper at Uttoxeter in October and has been second in two more, including last time in a Listed bumper at Cheltenham on Paddy Power day. She was meant to be going to Fontwell on Monday for a mares' novice hurdle, but she missed that and will probably go to Huntingdon just before Christmas. She's been schooling very well and I'm really excited by her. She comes from a wonderful family, being a half-sister to five winners including Martello Sky. She's my dark horse. 10-12-25

runners.comment: Won bumper on her debut at Stratford last October; shaped well in two starts over hurdles.
runners.name: Watamu
runners.spotlight: Landed a bumper on debut at Stratford for Pat Murphy last October; shaped nicely in her two starts over hurdles, latest when fifth of eight finishers in a Listed contest at Newbury (2m, soft) last month; holds place claims.

12:50.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S Shiel, D Savage & T Nolan
runners.comment: Fell two out when pressing the leaders on chasing debut at Haydock 19 days ago.
runners.name: He Knows Better
runners.owner: Mrs Isobel Webb & Mrs Julie Fowler
runners.spotlight: Showed a decent level of form over hurdles, winning at Fontwell in May 2024; first run since when falling two out on chasing debut when pressing the leaders at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft) 19 days ago; steps up in trip and should run well if none the worse.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Harry Whittington and was third on his first start for us at Uttoxeter. He got tired on testing ground but has come out of the race well and we'll look for something similar next time. He's got a bright future as a chaser next season. 13-12-23

runners.comment: Won twice over hurdles two seasons back but tailed off on chasing debut at Wetherby.
runners.name: El Saviour

quotes.race: Denis O'Connell Memorial 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Saviour had an injury last year but John and Jackie have given him time and it's paid dividends. He's such a big horse and still learning but I was pleased with how he battled there on his first start in more than 18 months. We'll go chasing with him next season - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual winner over hurdles a couple of seasons back but tailed off in first-time tongue-tie (retained today) on chasing debut at Wetherby (3m, soft) 16 days ago following 20-month absence; first-time cheekpieces now go on but big step forward required.

runners.comment: Solid second at Chepstow last month on first run for a year; should run well.
runners.name: Petty Cash
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who got off the mark over fences at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) in November last year; solid second back there (2m3f) last month on first run since and should be suited by the step back up in trip; should run well.

runners.comment: Pulled up on chase debut over C&D last month having reportedly bled from the nose.
runners.name: Baby Sage
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdles winner; pulled up on chase debut over C&D (good to soft) last month having reportedly bled from the nose; attracted a bit of money that day and better was clearly expected, so she is not one to give up on.

stable_tour.quote: She had a back problem and has been off for some time. But she had a long break, is working well now and made a pleasing return at Warwick on Tuesday when third. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Always behind when fifth of six finishers on chase debut at Uttoxeter last month.
runners.name: Night Duty
runners.spotlight: Scored over hurdles at Exeter in March but never in contention when fifth of six finishers on chase debut at Uttoxeter (3m2f, soft) last month minus usual cheekpieces (back on here); better is required.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet
runners.comment: Has a mixed record since winning at Ffos Las last November.
runners.name: Impatient
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning at Ffos Las last November at 40-1; has a mixed record since but made a fine return from five months off when second at Uttoxeter (3m, good) in October before failing to land the same race as last year at Ffos Las; hard to predict.

stable_tour.quote: He's needed time to fill his frame but ran very well on his first start over hurdles at Carlisle last month. He ran a bit green but I'd say the first three aren't bad and it was a good start. Hopefully he'll improve for the run and I'd say he'll be a nice staying chaser in time. We'll probably keep him to two and a half miles over hurdles for now. 14-11-23

runners.comment: Won a bumper and over hurdles but is 0-7 over fences; step back up in trip should suit.
runners.name: Realisation
runners.spotlight: Has won a bumper and over hurdles but is 0-7 over fences; edging down the weights and the step back up in trip should suit; place claims.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely mare who won her bumper nicely at Bangor in October. We have taken our time with her as she is still a very weak individual but there is clearly a motor under the bonnet. She is doing well at home and we will be looking for another bumper to win later this month and then decide if we should up her in class. I think she is very capable of stepping up in grade and, as I have said already, we have some lovely youngsters this season; she is definitely on that list. 11-01-23

runners.comment: Made an encouraging chase debut when third of five finishers at Warwick last month.
runners.name: Thruthelookinglass
runners.spotlight: Maiden under rules and has been lightly raced; made an encouraging chase debut when third of five finishers at Warwick (2m4f, soft) last month and this step back up in trip should suit; not out of this.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky not to win at Worcester a couple of years ago and we ran him on soft ground a couple of times last year ,which didn't really suit him. He's had quite a bit of time off and, if he comes back on the racecourse, I think he could surprise a few people. 19-11-24

runners.comment: Didn't shine last month in his two starts over fences, latest when fifth at Hereford.
runners.name: The Long Point
runners.spotlight: Maiden bumper winner in May 2024; didn't shine last month in his two starts over fences, latest when fifth of six finishers at Hereford (3m1f, good) in first-time cheekpieces (retained); still only six and may do better in time.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing last season and I couldn't tell you why. He'd travelled well through his bumper but I don't think he's actually that quick. He's schooled really well over a fence and I think a staying novice handicap chase will suit him, although he disappointed on Monday. 05-11-25

runners.breeder: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; should benefit from his run when third at Market Rasen last month.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was lovely to get back on Mixedwave. I'm very fortunate that the owners are supportive and Pam (Sly) is so loyal and a lovely lady. He's massive and not a hurdler, so when he came to chasing he soon found his form and keeps winning. He's put the race to bed nicely and has managed to stay ahead of the handicapper - Alex Edwards, rider.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Racing Bank Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mixedwave deserved that really as he was disqualified the other day although we have moved on from that. He seems to be improving with his racing and hopefully there is more to come -  Pam Sly, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner; should benefit from his run when third of five finishers at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft) last month; 1lb lower than for his last win here and should be competitive.

runners.comment: Goes well here (course form 122) and latest win was over C&D 15 days ago.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race may have fell apart but Zacony Rebel still had to win it and it was nice how he kept on after the last to put the race to bed - James Best, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Goes well here (course form 122) and latest win was over C&D 15 days ago (soft); that race did fall apart somewhat and this looks tougher but he can't be discounted.

runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles and is not progressing as yet but he steps up in trip and is down a couple of pounds, so cannot be dismissed.

runners.comment: Yet to be placed from five starts and not progressing; steps up in trip.
runners.name: Lair Du Large
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed from five starts and not progressing; steps up in trip and sports first-time cheekpieces; best watched unless there is a market move.

quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Harthill's owner Emma Stewart, who's at home. He wants soft ground and is a big horse who will jump fences in time - David Dennis, trainer.

14:20.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won over hurdles at Chepstow in October and good third at Cheltenham last month.
runners.name: Frontier Prince
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who got off the mark over hurdles at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) in October; made a pleasing handicap debut when third of 13 finishers at Cheltenham (2m, soft) last month and should run well.

runners.breeder: Al Shiraaa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: 2nd in 2024 Derby; fourth at Cheltenham on his hurdles debut and won over C&D 15 days ago.
runners.name: Ambiente Friendly

quotes.race: Sky Bet Super Sub Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Friendly has been a challenge. He is a horse with an extreme amount of ability. He has had two massive runs in the English and Irish Derby, but he has gone off the rails since then. It has been small steps on the way back. It is just nice to see him progress from that first Cheltenham run over hurdles. He is enjoying this now. If we can keep getting his form to rise over hurdles, we will come back on the Flat as he is still a young horse. We have always thought he is a horse that stays well and to be placed in an English and Irish Derby you have to stay well. It is just teaching him to run at fifteen seconds a furlong and not twelve seconds, but he is starting to do it. I was worried coming here on soft ground, but they have got to learn, and it was nice to see him do it today. It is a relief. He settled better today and I just love the way he battled. Usually, flat horses give up when they get headed, but he battled well and stayed well. We are still a long way off, but it is another small step back. He will get another couple of days' practice and the County Hurdle will be a right race for him at Cheltenham. There will be a big field, and they will go quick enough for him early on, and he will stay on well up the hill. We are a long way off, but he has got the class if he puts that together - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish Derby (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Friendly travelled really well to the two pole and just got outstayed in the last furlong. The winner and the second are both very good horses. I still think we'll probably be dropping back in trip next time - James Fanshawe, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: I'm really thrilled with his run. Ambiente Friendly did absolutely nothing wrong. I thought coming to the two-furlong pole we had a real chance, and then obviously City Of Troy was back to his best, so we got beaten fair and square. No excuses, he ran a really good race and I'm delighted with him, and with the team back at home, who have done a great job. City Of Troy on his day is a very good horse, and so are we, but I hope there is more to come from him because he's still got a lot of maturing to do, so I'm looking forward to the rest of the season with him. He's taking his racing so much better now - he settled well today and stayed well, so there's a lot to look forward to - James Fanshawe, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was exceptional. I've been riding Ambiente Friendly in lots of his work and he had come on so much from his run at Newmarket. They were much quicker conditions here, which he was unproven on, but he handled it beautifully. I couldn't speak highly enough of him - that was excellent. It felt to me like a proper trial. There was a nice even gallop and we got racing on the turn in, but I can't believe how he split the field so comfortably - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Newcomers Maiden Stakes (For horses which have never run) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Friendly showed us a little bit of ability at home, but you never know until you get them on the track and I'm delighted for the Gredleys that he's looked as impressive as he did. He'll have really enjoyed that today. They haven't gone quick and Tom has got him relaxed and in a rhythm and he went through the gears. It's a field of newcomers so you don't know what you've come up against but he's done it in nice style and hopefully he'll be a horse to follow - Tom Fanshawe, trainer's son and assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the 2024 Derby and third in the Irish Derby; went off the rails subsequently on Flat but showed he has a future in this sphere when fourth at Cheltenham (2m, soft) on his hurdles debut and winning over C&D (soft) 15 days ago; makes handicap debut and a fascinating contender.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't lived up to the heights of his two great Derby runs and has run nowhere close to that form since. Now he's been gelded it makes sense to run him under both codes and we're going to start him off somewhere like Huntingdon early next month in a maiden hurdle. If he takes to it we'll carry on. If he doesn't we'll go back to the Flat. He schools really well and jumps very fast. If it goes to plan at Huntingdon, he'd go to Cheltenham for the November meeting. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Won twice over hurdles last term, winning twice, but has not been in the same form since.
runners.name: Aviemore

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aviemore definitely took a step forward from his hurdling debut and he was entitled to. He benefited from that initial experience and he's not a bad little horse. He galloped all the way to the line and the team can have a lot of fun with him. He has Flat form on heavy ground, so he's versatile regarding conditions - Alice Stevens, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Made a good start to his hurdling career last term, winning twice including over C&D; has not been in the same form in two runs this autumn and all of a sudden has something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a bit disappointing in two runs on the Flat and over hurdles this autumn, so we're going to wait and run him on some proper soft ground. It's a difficult year for them after winning a couple of juvenile races. I think we'll have to go up in trip at some stage. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Progressive over hurdles, winning two of his last three this term; major player.
runners.name: Across Earth
runners.spotlight: Progressive over hurdles, winning two of his last three this term, latest when benefiting from being held up when successful at Sandown (2m, soft) 17 days ago; up 6lb but on the upgrade and looks a major player.

runners.comment: Well beaten by his stablemate Across Earth at Sandown 17 days ago.
runners.name: Galactic Charm

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Xv And Partner

runners.spotlight: Took well to hurdles last season, winning at Fontwell and runner-up four times; it has not been plain sailing this term and he was well beaten by his stablemate Across Earth at Sandown 17 days ago.

stable_tour.quote: He was rated 80 on the Flat and ran constantly well over hurdles last season. We're aiming him at a new race for four-year-olds at the Tingle Creek meeting. It's a 0-120 and should suit him well. 28-10-25

runners.comment: Won twice over hurdles in March, including over C&D; well beaten in three starts since.
runners.name: Benvoy

quotes.race: Sodexo Live! Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jo [Davis, trainer] got Benvoy and apparently he wasn't a great jumper, but she's got loads of land at her yard and does showjumping, so she's done plenty of work on him. When I rode him the first time at Market Rasen, I didn't think he'd make a racehorse. Don't take it out of context, but I didn't think he'd be like he is today - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles in March, including over C&D, but well beaten in his three starts since; blinkers worn when trained in Ireland on the Flat return but he has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Won at Worcester in September but beaten by Across Earth last time.
runners.name: Caelan

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Caelan is still a big, raw horse. He won first-time out but ended up being quite immature and he was running a bit free but today he's done everything the right way round, although he wasn't doing a tap in front. He's taken well to all-weather surfaces but I don't see why he won't be just as effective on the grass - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over hurdles at Worcester (2m, good to soft) in September in first-time hood; ran his best race when second over C&D (good) last month but beaten by Across Earth at Sandown since; may have more to offer back here.

runners.comment: Second at Hereford (2m) on chase debut; player on that but not proven on softer than good
runners.name: Electric Eddy
runners.spotlight: Raced far too freely in front under an amateur on reappearance, after a year off; straight back on song when second of eight in novice handicap at Hereford (2m) four weeks ago on chase debut; player on that but he's not proven on softer than good and is unraced on soft.

runners.comment: Often front-runner; 0-9 as chaser; 2nd twice before disappointing at Wetherby 16 days ago
runners.name: Catchim
runners.spotlight: Often front-runner; 0-9 over fences; runner-up off this mark here (2m4f, good) and at Southwell (2m, soft) in November, before a disappointing show at Wetherby 16 days ago; chance if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Inconsistent in his four chases but the two placed efforts need respect; now tongue tied
runners.name: Touquet
runners.spotlight: Went the wrong way over hurdles for Paul Nicholls and inconsistent in his four chases for Nick Gifford, but the two placed efforts at Lingfield (2m, good/good to soft; helped set the pace) this season need some respect; had wind surgery in the spring and now has his tongue tied.

stable_tour.quote: He returned from a summer breathing operation to run out a decisive winner of a two-mile novice hurdle at Plumpton last month, despite looking green and running free early on in a first-time hood. He has a lot of ability but still has plenty to learn and we just need him to settle a bit better. He looks the sort to qualify for the EBF Final at Sandown in early March. He'll be suited by a step up in trip. 04-11-24

His owner Graeme Brooks has four or five with Paul Nicholls and he sponsors my yard. He sent me Touquet from Paul's just for a change of scenery. He'd been pulled up on his last two starts when he left there and started with a pulled-up effort on his first run for me, but it's dropping him back to 2m that I think is the key to him - and he was second behind Jorebel when we did that at Lingfield last month. Then he was fourth behind the same horse at Plumpton on Monday. At the moment, while he's still quite keen, he doesn't get much beyond 2m/2m1f. I'm sure he'll get 2m4f in time when he learns to settle, but for now we'll run over 2m and just let him go. 03-12-25

runners.comment: Five races; 574 days off before second on chase debut at Southwell (2m, soft; Catchim 2nd)
runners.name: Zoeman
runners.spotlight: 6yo who has had just five races; soundly beaten on his handicap hurdle debut in April 2024 and absent 574 days before his chase debut in handicap at Southwell (2m, soft) last month but that was a lot better, coming from off the pace to be third of six (Catchim second); needs to build on that.

runners.comment: 2-5 over fences; not so good on last two starts, so there are mixed messages
runners.name: Belle Montrose
runners.spotlight: Wins at Uttoxeter in September and Fakenham (also 2m, good) in October were the clear highlights among her five chases; ran badly at Fakenham on penultimate start and only partially revived with cheekpieces enlisted at Sedgefield latest, so there are mixed messages.

runners.comment: Unlucky not to win two in a row in October but he stopped quickly here on latest start
runners.name: Grain Trade
runners.spotlight: Not proven on soft; won at Market Rasen (2m4f) and looked booked to complete his double when coming down at Fontwell (2m2f) later in October; it's unclear what happened at Huntingdon (2m4f) on latest start as he stopped very quickly; in with a shout if he can bounce back from that.

runners.comment: 0-16; three consecutive seconds before pulled up on soft ground at Southwell latest start
runners.name: Pottersjetamay
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 16 races; three consecutive seconds in small fields this year, in handicap chases last two occasions, but pulled up behind two of these rivals on soft ground at Southwell latest start; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Much better when second at Sedgefield (2m, soft) four weeks ago on her second chase start

runners.name: Ballybay

runners.comment: Five races, with a 31l defeat his closest finish; him dropped in trip for this chase debut

runners.name: Hitintheheadlines

runners.comment: Won Irish mares' maiden point in April; £40,000 sale in May; one to note from a top yard
runners.name: Viscountess Nelson
runners.owner: Old Gold Racing With Francesca Cumani
runners.spotlight: 36,000euros foal; second foal; half-sister to a Slovakian 1m3f/1m4f winner; dam a 1m6f-2m1f Flat (RPR 97) and 2m hurdle winner; won an Irish mares' maiden point in April and sold for £40,000 in May; one to note from a top yard, particularly if strong in the betting.

stable_tour.quote: She won a mares' point-to-point. From the little we've seen, you'd not be frightened to start over two miles, or even in a bumper. She's only cantering, but she looks as though she'll go along a bit. 21-10-25

runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Staying-on second of 12 at Moulins (1m4f, very soft) in France in April was an encouraging
runners.name: Milpat
runners.spotlight: 29,000euros 2yo: first foal; dam 1m4f French bumper winner, placed over hurdles, out of unraced half-sister to winners Illico (smart 2m/2m2f hurdle) and Fulip (useful 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase); staying-on second of 12 in a bumper at Moulins (1m4f, very soft) in France in April was an encouraging start.

runners.comment: Leading 1m out to over 1f out at Wetherby (2m, soft; 17-2) 16 days ago showed some ability
runners.name: Winstons Oath

runners.comment: First foal; dam bumper and fairly useful 2m hurdle winner; trainer won a bumper in 2024
runners.name: Potters Honour
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam bumper and fairly useful 2m hurdle winner, out of 2m hurdle winner; trainer had a bumper winner on rules debut (having been pointing) in April 2024.
