runners.comment: Impressed in winning his bumper; respectable third last time and sent further now
runners.name: Abbey Scope
runners.spotlight: Impressed in his bumper win at Kelso and was returning from seven months off when beaten just over 11l into third on hurdling debut at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft); entitled to step up on that effort here over a longer distance.

runners.comment: Beaten in six points, four bumpers and two maiden hurdles when based in Ireland
runners.name: Barrakilla Vage
runners.spotlight: Beaten in six points, four bumpers and two maiden hurdles when based in Ireland; unlikely to be winning this.

runners.comment: Point winner; his second in a Bangor maiden entitles him to strong form claims here
runners.name: Judicial Deference
runners.spotlight: Took six goes to win an Irish point before changing hands for 22,000euros; had wind surgery prior to hurdling debut and, with a tongue-tie added, he pushed the favourite close at Bangor (2m3f, soft); that entitles him to strong form claims here.

runners.comment: Exposed as limited on the Flat and over hurdles; outclassed in a maiden
runners.name: Masterminding
runners.spotlight: Exposed as limited on the Flat and over hurdles; outclassed in a maiden.

runners.comment: Competitive in maidens over slightly further at Perth and Kelso (both on soft)
runners.name: The G Wizard
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point and competitive in maidens over slightly further at Perth and Kelso (both on soft); he's up to winning a race of this nature.

runners.comment: Became disappointing on the Flat but was useful at his best; has the stamina for this
runners.name: Whos Glen
runners.spotlight: Bought for 22,000gns out of the Andrew Balding yard for which he became disappointing this year but was useful at his best; has the stamina for hurdling and ability is respected.

13:08.race_name: Virgin Bet Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who found only one too good back over 2m here last month
runners.name: Okavango Delta

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The race went to plan. We went a nice, even gallop but I was really concerned about the ground with Okavango Delta. Musselburgh, luckily, when it gets soft it doesn't get too deep, so he's handled it fine. He's in good form and he's got his second round here now. You don't want to hit the front too soon with him, but he jumps so well you often land in front early enough, so you've got to hope he takes you through the race. In fairness, when I committed today, with the cheekpieces on he's honest enough - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who found only one too good back over 2m here last month (good to soft) on his first sighting since July; the return to further is an obvious plus; chance.

runners.comment: Improving hurdler this season and connections evidently keen on getting her over fences
runners.name: Mountain Molly
runners.spotlight: Perth novice hurdle winner who was better again on her handicap debut there (2m4f, soft), finishing a clear second behind the favourite; won her only point and connections are evidently keen on getting her over fences; much respected.

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Challenging when falling two out on his chase/handicap debut at Sedgefield
runners.name: Kadjar Des Mottes
runners.spotlight: Unable to win over hurdles (0-5) but this point winner was challenging when falling two out on his chase/handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m5f, soft); same mark here and a likely contender.

runners.comment: Should be well handicapped but this year has been a struggle; now 1-11 over fences
runners.name: Carcaci Castle

prev_owners.owner: M Mcpherson And Mrs Q Thomson
Mr And Mrs M Mcpherson And Mrs Q Thomson

runners.spotlight: Should be well handicapped but this year has been a struggle and he's now only 1-11 over fences; others safer.

stable_tour.quote: We got him all wrong last season. His best runs have been over a very stiff 2m, at Hexham and Carlisle, but it's been a nightmare because there are no races for him. He went to Kelso just after Christmas and the ground was just too quick for him, but he stayed on really nicely to be third. Hopefully, with the soft ground coming, some of these 2m handicap chases will come right for him. There are definitely races to be won with him. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Made all over C&D last month despite not having it all her own way up front; raised 4lb
runners.name: Ofaolains Glory

quotes.race: Paddy Madine Tareesh Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Ian has a good job done schooling with O'Faolains Glory and she had been round a couple of point-to-point tracks and that. We knew that's the way to ride her, go hard. She pulled herself up a bit, but thankfully we held on - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 1-22 over hurdles and now 2-9 over fences after making most of the running over C&D (good to soft) last month, when she didn't have it all her own way up front; 4lb higher with Conor Rabbitt again taking off 5lb; in the mix.

runners.comment: Third run over fences when scoring over further here 14 days ago; fine at this trip
runners.name: Benefit Ben
runners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who got off the mark over fences at the third attempt in a 2m7f handicap here two weeks ago (soft; blinkers returned); quick enough for this trip and a 5lb rise isn't the end of the world.

runners.comment: Maiden chaser (0-7) and will need to step up on his three efforts following a break
runners.name: Scots Poet
runners.spotlight: Won four times over hurdles but remains a maiden chaser (0-7) and will need to step up on his three efforts following a break.

runners.comment: Only 1-24 overall and tailed off in both disciplines following wind surgery
runners.name: Nights In Venice

quotes.race: New Bet-In-Race With Coral Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Night In Milan is improving. He was doing too much with me over three miles at Carlisle last time which caught him out. Donald talked about dropping him back in trip in this and it's worked out nicely - Henry Brooke, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Coming on two years since sole career success in a 2m4f handicap chase at Ayr; has finished tailed off in both disciplines following wind surgery.

13:38.race_name: Livescore Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Hasn't run at all badly in his two novices and there could be improvement to come
runners.name: Magna Victor
runners.spotlight: Doesn't look overly well treated for this handicap debut but hasn't run at all badly in his two novices and there could be improvement to come.

stable_tour.quote: No relation to Magna Sam, he's had just three runs, including in two bumpers. He ran nicely first time over hurdles and is improving quite a lot. He's got quite a funny pedigree, but we do like him a lot. He's going in the right direction and I think he'll be quite nice. 19-02-25

runners.comment: Very quiet in two runs after a break and looks the stable second string
runners.name: Maple
runners.owner: R Whitelock, L Clemitson & R Jefferson
runners.spotlight: Uttoxeter winner in May but very quiet in two runs after a break and looks the stable second string.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very buzzy horse who came from Newmarket. He had a reputation as being very keen - we've got him to settle down a bit as it's a bit quieter here and got him to do all his learning when he went racing. We never worked him, we just schooled him around and he got there in the end, winning at Uttoxeter in May. He was only tenth on his seasonal reappearance at Ayr on November 1, but he's had runs like that before. He probably likes a little bit more room when he comes to fight out the finish. Craig Nichol tried to follow a horse through but got the door shut a couple of times on him. We won't worry too much; I'm sure he'll bounce back. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Won quite comfortably at Sedgefield recently and he can cope with this 6lb higher mark
runners.name: Bathgate
runners.spotlight: Followed two near misses with a pretty convincing win at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) earlier this month and he can cope with this 6lb higher mark.

runners.comment: 20-1 and was well beaten on his return to hurdling over C&D last month
runners.name: Jaminoz
runners.spotlight: The last of six Flat wins was in September; 20-1 and was well beaten on his return to hurdling over C&D last month; this is a lower grade.

runners.comment: Good hurdler about four years ago; second run after long absence was better than the first
runners.name: Inca Prince
runners.owner: R Whitelock, L Clemitson & R Jefferson

quotes.race: Go North Grey Bomber Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inca Prince is free-going and not the most straightforward but he's rideable, I suppose. Jamie gets on with him very well, and to be fair under his weight to be as keen as he was and keep going he's got to be very genuine. You're more a passenger than a driver with him, he's quite a character - Ruth Jefferson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Good hurdler about four years ago and thrown in on all that form; second run after a long absence was better than the first and wouldn't be giving up on him just yet.

stable_tour.quote: He was good as a juvenile and didn't run too badly in his four-year-old career but then got a leg. He's just back from that. He's had two runs back over hurdles and his leg seems fine. He'll be one to aim at one of the Go North finals because he likes Musselburgh. 19-11-25

runners.comment: May have turned a corner having made a successful yard debut at Sedgefield
runners.name: John Betjeman

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

quotes.race: Thatchers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Betjeman is terrible in front but he's game and we're lucky to have him. There's been a few seconds and he's been unlucky in life, but he's run 75 times and won more than 70,000GBP in prize money, so we feel fortunate to have him around. He's been incredibly sound, we've never had a problem with him, and he'll be out in the paddock before he goes to bed. He's an amazing horse and we're delighted he's done it. My son Fergus rang me up and mentioned the visor. We've had the blinkers on and off to keep him sweet but luckily it worked. We had a bottle of champagne after he won and we'll be getting another! -  Mark Gillard, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Exposed 9yo but it was his debut for this yard after 173 days off when repelling subsequent winner Bathgate at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft); raised 8lb for that but he was rated higher in the past; could have turned a corner.

runners.comment: Flat/hurdle winner but lost his way for former yard and was sold on for 3,400gns
runners.name: Spartan Warrior
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Kelso in May (2m2f, good) but well held under both codes since then and was moved on for 3,400gns; wouldn't be the obvious answer to this.

stable_tour.quote: He's the first horse we've had for Jimmy Fyffe and was rated 71 on the Flat when trained by Ollie Sangster, winning at 1m2f and 1m4f. He's schooled very well and will start in a juvenile hurdle at Musselburgh at the end of November, with a view to looking at some of the lucrative juvenile hurdles if we can. 16-10-24

runners.comment: Uninspiring Flat form before another heavy defeat here last month on return to jumping
runners.name: Rory The Cat

quotes.race: Champagne Pommery Cuvee Louise Handicap
quotes.quote: Rory The Cat is very versatile. He's been in good nick. He won well and I'm sure he can go in again - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Hair Of The Dog Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When we tried Rory The Cat in the cheekpieces he just didn't go but blinkers have just made him. His jumping was perfect, Derek timed it brilliantly and he galloped on so well. It's just a great way to start the year and it's great for The Cool Cats. He'll get a handicap mark now but he'll definitely go for the Listed race here next month and he might even get into the juvenile handicap at Cheltenham, which would be great because he's so professional. He's just a brilliant little horse, as he was only 6,000gns at the sales - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Uninspiring Flat form before another heavy defeat here last month on return to jumping; opposable.

runners.comment: Beaten about 7l when hitting the frame over C&D recently and that was a Class 4
runners.name: Gemini Man
runners.spotlight: 2-34 overall and 1-11 as a hurdler; beaten about 7l when hitting the frame over C&D recently and that was a Class 4 handicap; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Hexham last month and seems to be a better horse over hurdles than on the Flat. He's gone up 5lb, which is all right, and has come out of the race well. There's a race at the first Kelso meeting that could be ideal. 10-09-25

runners.comment: He ran well behind a heavily-backed favourite over C&D two weeks ago; 2lb higher
runners.name: Gonnino
runners.spotlight: Just the one blip this year and he ran well behind a heavily-backed favourite over C&D two weeks ago; only 2lb higher and should feature.

runners.comment: Unconvincing claims on handicap debut with a hood now tried
runners.name: Miss Bumblebee
runners.spotlight: Her thirds at Hexham were remote and was pulled up back there in early November; unconvincing claims on handicap debut with a hood now tried.

runners.comment: Ran quite well at Sedgefield last time given soft was probably not ideal for him
runners.name: National Question

quotes.race: Ocean Outdoor Big Screen Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: National Question might have limited ability, but really tries hard - Adam Nicol, trainer.

runners.spotlight: All three wins (Flat/hurdles) have been on good ground so ran quite well at Sedgefield last time given soft was probably not ideal for him; raised 3lb for that but gets in here off a low weight; considered.

14:08.race_name: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Potentially on a fair mark for first run since June; new trainer has booked Brian Hughes
runners.name: Special Rate

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Special Rate jumped brilliant. I let him run to the front down the back, I thought he'll stay anyway and he's kept galloping - Ross Chapman, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner; failed to win in eight runs for his previous yard but was placed and he's potentially on a fair mark for his first run since June; Brian Hughes is also booked.

runners.comment: Might be getting readied for another crack at the Edinburgh National here in early Feb
runners.name: Magna Sam

quotes.race: bet365 Edinburgh National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's really nice to get Magna Sam back. He had some issues last season, we were just missing something. We did it [his wind] after his break and obviously it's showing dividends now. He had a little blow at the back of two out at Doncaster and it was a nice confidence-booster for him - Alastair Ralph, trainer.

runners.spotlight: A better horse over further and might be getting readied for another crack at the Edinburgh National here in early February, having won that race twice before.

stable_tour.quote: He's won two Edinburgh Nationals now, this year and in 2023. Nothing seemed to click with him last year, but he made a noise a couple of times and we gastroscoped him and found he had ulcers and we did his wind. He had a nice break and showed nice form on his comeback at Doncaster. He tied up a bit there and we thought the cheekpieces would help at Musselburgh and he was always travelling well. It's a track he likes and the better ground helped him as well. We're tempted to sit tight and go straight to Ayr for the Scottish National. He ran well in the race two years ago and likes to be fresh and well. 19-02-25

runners.comment: Encouraging return at Carlisle but he was never really going back there in November
runners.name: Inis Oirr
runners.spotlight: Having lost his way last season, it was an encouraging return when losing out narrowly at Carlisle (3m, good); however, suffered another backward step when never really going on his return there.

stable_tour.quote: We changed tactics at Carlisle the other day and it worked wonders as he was probably getting a bit sick of being bullied out in front. We're thinking of going for another Edinburgh National as he's got to go right-handed. He seems much more back to himself. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Four hurdle wins but has lost his way a bit; jumped poorly on chase debut two runs back
runners.name: Kilmore Rock
runners.spotlight: Resigtered a hat-trick over hurdles after being fitted with cheekpieces earlier this year; the wheels have come off since and his jumping left much to be desired on his chase debut two runs back.

runners.comment: In front when clouting two out at Ayr before coming down at the last; must avoid errors
runners.name: Forged Well
runners.owner: Mrs Suzy Brown & Peter R Brown
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; made no impact in his first chase but ran a lot better in his second as he was still in front when clouting two out at Ayr (3m, soft) before coming down at the last; needs to avoid errors but there's a big run in him.

runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.comment: Pulled up at Market Rasen in July and that's a track he usually runs so well
runners.name: Giovanni Change
runners.owner: Readers & Wiggy, The 8 Amigos & J Burns

quotes.race: Chris Coley BEM Celebration Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change used to boot hurdles out the ground but that was his best round of jumping, he was superb and he's given his owners such a wonderful time. He was on my list at the sales a few years ago but I was worried he'd be too expensive. I was told he's blind in one eye, asymmetrical behind and is a terrible box-walker, so I thought at least I might be able to afford him. We took his eye out and we couldn't train him and he wouldn't eat, but we've got outdoor stables now and he's perfect in there. That's his sixth win at this track and he's been remarkable - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Victor Lucas Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change is just the most genuine horse you are ever going to see. He has only got one eye, that is his fifth win now, his fourth at Market Rasen. He just won on the Flat at Ponterfract, what more can you ask for- Neil Readman, co-owner, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: MansionBet #morethanthenational Faller Insurance Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change has run some very good races in defeat in novices and a nice break has worked a treat with him. We've always thought he's a really nice horse, he has some good novice hurdle form that stacks up and hopefully we can pick up a nice race with him - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Europe Hotel Killarney INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: We have actually had Giovanni Change a while but he's been a bit of a slow burner. He definitely wouldn't like it any quicker. I'm surprised by that and he will be a nice horse going forward for the future. The further he goes the better I'd say, and he might even make into a winter horse. I wouldn't be afraid of slower ground as he has a fair knee action - trainer Emmet Mullins.

runners.spotlight: Pulled up at Market Rasen in July and that's a track he usually runs so well; others look safer on this return from a break.

runners.comment: Three wins this year; needs to better his last performance and there are stamina doubts
runners.name: Too Cool Forshrule
runners.spotlight: Has won three handicaps this year, two over fences; still on a competitive mark but will need to better his last performance and there are stamina doubts.

runners.comment: Now goes in cheekpieces from 4lb out of the weights; others are more convincing
runners.name: Swallows Song
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 0-9 over hurdles and 0-4 as a chaser after latest 20l defeat at Ayr (3m); now goes in cheekpieces from 4lb out of the weights; others are more convincing.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who missed a season through injury but is back in work now. He was progressing nicely and he can win races if we can keep him right. We'll probably start over hurdles but he's a chaser in the making. We really like him. 10-09-25

14:38.race_name: Virgin Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: One notable run out of three for this yard when winning over 2m at Ayr (2m, soft)
runners.name: Dees Getaway
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; one notable run out of three for this yard when winning over 2m at Ayr (2m, soft); has disappointed on either side of that and has stamina to prove over this far.

runners.comment: Back on a tempting mark and there were signs of a revival last time
runners.name: Asa

quotes.race: Traffic Management Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asa's been a bit disappointing but now she seems to have turned a corner.  I don't know what happened at Worcester last time as she never went a yard. I don't know if the first-time cheekpieces worked, but it's onwards and upwards now - Philip Kirby, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Last season went well once the cheekpieces were refitted; back on a tempting mark and there were signs of a revival last time at Kelso; that was over 2m5f and this trip is a better fit; considered.

runners.comment: Course maiden winner over 2m4f; today's greater emphasis on stamina could suit
runners.name: Lizzie Luna

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: The second horse has went off at a good distance but, to be honest, I was in behind a few so I just rode a race. I used Danny [McMenamin] on the third as a tow and I hoped the horse in front would tie up and he did. She jumped really well and is genuine - Craig Nicol, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Unraced beyond 2m4f over which she gained her only win in a maiden here in February; was running on when third over that far here last time so today's greater emphasis on stamina could suit.

runners.comment: Left Gordon Elliott for £3,500 but it wasn't that bad a run last time at Ayr
runners.name: Cher Tara
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-15 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott whom he left for £3,500; it wasn't that bad a run last time when fifth at Ayr (2m3f) and hasn't had many chances over this sort of distance; could go well.

runners.comment: Four wins over hurdles and now back in this discipline after struggling over fences
runners.name: Luminaries

quotes.race: Borders Growers & Distillers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Luminaries has been absolutely brilliant for the yard and he's been a big help to me. He's very easy to train at home and he goes out with three or four horses every day, but he doesn't want a lot of hard work. When we got him last year, we got to the bottom of his problems and he seems a lot happier now. He's probably better in a smaller yard. After his last run at Bangor, when he was disappointing, we just chucked him in a field for a week and he's not done a lot of hard work since - Ewan Whillans, trainer.

quotes.race: Michael Knox Memorial Equine Products Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Luminaries had a big ulcer and it's just taken a bit of time to get him back, but we've always thought he's a horse who's capable of running a big race - Ewan Whillans, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four wins over hurdles and now back in this discipline after struggling over fences (visored the last twice); all wins have been in cheekpieces and those aids are again absent.

runners.comment: Stamina to prove but he is a last-time-out winner and only went up 2lb for that
runners.name: Beat The Retreat

quotes.race: Festive Dining At Western House Hotel Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Beat The Retreat has been inconsistent but that's the third race he's won and there's no reason why he won't go in again, he's still young enough. I didn't think he'd like the ground at all and, if the owners hadn't been here, I'd have left him at home - Nick Alexander, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Ayrshire Wedding Show At Ayr Racecourse Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I didn't really want to run Beat The Retreat on today's ground but the owner was keen. We could have waited until new year but it might have been even softer so we thought we'd take our chance, and it paid off - Nick Alexander, trainer.

runners.spotlight: His three wins have been from 2m2f to 2m4f and unconvincing in two previous attempts at 3m; however, he is a last-time-out winner and only went up 2lb for that.

runners.comment: A visor replaces blinkers but he very nearly opened his hurdling account two weeks ago
runners.name: Leader Wing
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who went close to opening his hurdling account over C&D two weeks ago; raised 3lb and surprising to see blinkers replaced after that bold showing, but one of the more appealing options.

runners.comment: Lightly raced since her two wins in 2024 but current wellbeing is an issue
runners.name: Bollin Matilda
runners.spotlight: Won twice over a similar distance in the spring of 2024 since when she's been lightly raced; current wellbeing is an issue.

runners.breeder: Mrs S C Welch & Mr A King
runners.comment: Returns to hurdling after four defeats over fences, though two of those were respectable
runners.name: Reflection Of You
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; returns to hurdling after four defeats over fences, though two of those were respectable; might go well on just her sixth start in this discipline.

runners.comment: Runs well now and again but wouldn't appear to be crying out for this longer trip
runners.name: State Of Honor
runners.spotlight: 2m5f winner for Tim Vaughan; beaten about 5l in two of her five runs for this yard but wouldn't appear to be crying out for this longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: She was unlucky at Hereford two starts ago as she would have won easily but for falling at the last. That was more than a year ago and she returned in the autumn, finishing fourth, but she doesn't care for winter ground and the owners have been very patient. She'll be out soon and will be nice and fresh. She has plenty of ability and should go close. 20-03-24

runners.comment: Ran poorly last time and this return to hurdles isn't an obvious positive (0-22)
runners.name: Dr Shirocco
runners.spotlight: Four chase wins include two here but ran poorly last time and this return to hurdles isn't an obvious positive (0-22).

runners.comment: Runner-up over a similar trip in May but very opposable on this balance of his form
runners.name: Dreamings Free
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over a similar trip at Hexham in May but very opposable on this balance of his form; still a maiden.

runners.comment: Nine-race maiden who has only one effort of note to his name; out of the weights
runners.name: Flying Sandpiper
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who has only one effort of note to his name; limited appeal from 6lb out of the weights.

15:08.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: First foal out of a French 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner; likely contender for strong yard
runners.name: Circle Of Steel
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a French 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner and half-sister to useful French 2m1f-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Dentor Des Obeaux; appeals as a likely contender on debut for strong yard.

runners.comment: Ran well to be third in an Irish point (3m, yielding) in October 2024
runners.name: Executive Producer

prev_owners.owner: Miss J Bedi, J Bell And Partners

runners.spotlight: Ran well to be third in an Irish point (3m, yielding) in October 2024 and the runner-up is now a winner under rules; tongue-tie added; could easily be competitive.

runners.comment: Beaten nearly 20l in a good-ground bumper at Catterick but the first two are promising
runners.name: Forever Louie
runners.spotlight: Beaten nearly 20l in a good-ground bumper at Catterick but the first two are promising; this might be weaker.

runners.comment: Newcomer; stable gets bumper winners so one to note in the betting
runners.name: Hawthorn Road
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Lisheen Prince (2m4f hurdle) and Jumping Susie (2m3f/2m5f hurdle); stable gets bumper winners so one to note in the betting.

runners.comment: 0-5 in Irish points and it was a weak race in which he threatened in early October
runners.name: Karma De Cotte
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in Irish points and it was a weak race in which he threatened in early October; could be vulnerable.

runners.comment: Back from 604 days off to win a small-field British 2m4f point on good ground a month ago
runners.name: Kilaro
runners.spotlight: Back from 604 days off to win a small-field British 2m4f point on good ground a month ago; unlikely that was much of a race but he's since joined a good yard.

runners.comment: Not shown a lot between the flags but Brian Hughes is a positive booking
runners.name: Return To Florida
runners.spotlight: Only sixth when made favourite for a point bumper and departed early in a 3m point in March; runs in some notable silks and Brian Hughes has been booked.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 3m-3m2f hurdle winner Townhill; dam unplaced in a bumper
runners.name: Oor Wish
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 3m-3m2f hurdle winner Townhill; dam unplaced in a bumper and half-sister to 2m3f-2m7f chase winner Joe Deane; stable 4-58 in bumpers recent seasons and probably best to look elsewhere.

16:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Half-brother to a winner (6.7f-1m2f) in Italy; doesn't have a daunting standard to aim at
runners.name: Baggie Boy
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to Italian 6.7f-1m2f winner Faroujah; unraced dam closely related to 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Kutub; doesn't have a daunting standard to aim at on debut and he's worth a market check.

runners.comment: Couldn't justify heavy support in a slowly run race at Lingfield last week; can do better
runners.name: Free Your Spirit
runners.owner: R Rexton, M Gander & M Osborne
runners.spotlight: 1-3 for his Lingfield debut last week (1m) but he failed to pick up in a slowly run race; should be capable of better but this looks a stronger race.

runners.comment: Modest form in two 7f Polytrack maidens this autumn; bred to do better in time
runners.name: Hamish Leek
runners.spotlight: He has run to a modest level in two 7f maidens on Polytrack this autumn; bred to do better at some stage.

runners.comment: Better run when front-running 6th at Chelmsford last month; widest stall not ideal though
runners.name: Meritocratic
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on debut but last month's Chelmsford sixth (7f; made the running; stablemate Hamish Leek over 6l behind him) was better; open to further progress but the widest stall isn't ideal.

runners.comment: Second run was better than his debut but he enjoyed the benefit of an easy lead
runners.name: Okiru
runners.spotlight: In need of the experience on his C&D debut last month; better when third of nine at Newcastle (7f) three weeks ago, when being able to dictate a steady pace helped to show him to good effect but he is still capable of better.

runners.comment: Big step forward on his 2nd start (1m) but he was well placed in a steadily run affair
runners.name: Galileo Blue
runners.spotlight: Stepped up from low-key debut to finish fourth in 1m novice at Kempton 19 days ago; prominent in a race that was slowly run to halfway there though and the form hasn't been advertised since; more needed.

runners.comment: Tailed off in three runs (6f-7f); impossible to recommend
runners.name: Sunday Sinatra
runners.spotlight: Has been allocated a BHA rating of 45 after three starts but she has been beaten 62l, 31l and 25l; impossible to recommend.

runners.comment: Poor form in three runs for Mark Usher; gelding operation and new yard but hard to fancy
runners.name: Telling Time
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three runs for Mark Usher in the summer (6f-7f); gelded prior to this stable debut (same owners); enough to prove.

runners.comment: Promise in two 6f runs for Peter Chapple-Hyam in October; 7f should suit on stable debut
runners.name: Backfire
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in two 6f runs for Peter Chapple-Hyam in October (including AW); bred to appreciate the extra furlong and she's not discounted on her stable debut.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden but conditions suit and she has the best form; obvious claims
runners.name: Sunshine And Roses
runners.spotlight: More exposed than her rivals but she's run well on several occasions, including all three Wolverhampton runs; chopped off at a crucial stage over C&D last week; unlikely to be found a better opportunity than this.

17:00.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Nursery Handicap

runners.comment: Chasing a four-timer; drops to 5f and should give it another good go
runners.name: American Flight
runners.spotlight: Progressive filly who has won her last three starts, showing a fine attitude on the last two occasions; drops back to 5f but her 3lb rise shouldn't be beyond her.

runners.comment: Two fair AW runs after a break but she needs a lift from the new headgar
runners.name: Canyouhearthedrums
runners.spotlight: Yarmouth win in July came in a small field; two creditabble runs on AW after a break but needs the new cheekpieces to give her a lift.

stable_tour.quote: She's had four runs but has disappointed me a bit - she travels so well but finds nothing off the bridle. I think we're going to try a tongue-tie on her next time to see if that helps. She should win a little race. 02-07-25

runners.comment: Ground an excuse last time but he is now 0-7 and needs to pull out more to win
runners.name: U S S Charleston
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who was reportedly unsuited by the ground when last of nine at Nottingham eight weeks ago; a career best will be required to break his duck though.

runners.comment: Won three of his last six but he was disappointing last time; has bounced back before
runners.name: Beach Partee
runners.owner: John & Peter Seabrook And Tim Fisher
runners.spotlight: The winner of three of his last six starts; disappointing at Chelmsford 18 days ago but he is 3lb lower today and has bounced back from a modest run in the past.

runners.comment: Drop to an easy 5f could suit and he's slipped a long way down the weights
runners.name: Mister Moet
runners.spotlight: Hasn't progressed from a 6f novice win in May; he has shown speed in two 6f runs for new connections and dropping back to an easy 5f could have a positive effect.

17:30.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: C&D winner but all handicap success has come over 6f; still likely to go well
runners.name: Em Jay Kay
runners.spotlight: Won his novice over C&D but all four handicap wins have come over an extra furlong; arrives in good form and should make another bold bid.

runners.comment: Seven-time course winner; held form since the latest of them last month; contender
runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.spotlight: Seven course wins to his name, the latest coming last month when rated 9lb lower; he has held his form since and finished in front of two of these nine days ago; wouldn't be sure to confirm the placings with either this time though.

runners.comment: Conditions ideal and she has landed stall 1; sharper for recent return; much respected
runners.name: Wedgewood
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer with four C&D wins on her record, the latest off this mark in April; recent Lingfield reappearance should have blown away the cobwebs and she's greatly respected from stall 1.

runners.comment: 0-11 but has ability and things will drop right for her one day
runners.name: Spendmore Lane
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; has shown some promise and although she was behind a couple of these over C&D nine days ago, she was chopped off against the far rail at a crucial stage; has the ability to win off this mark but it will require everything to drop right.

runners.comment: Eye-catching stable debut here nine days ago; Billy Loughnane booked; well handicapped
runners.name: Amerjeet
runners.spotlight: He has tumbled down the weights since his sole success (July 2024) and there was plenty of promise in his recent stable debut, missing the break but making steady headway in the straight (the 1-2-3 were in the first three positions throughout); chance he'll get it wrong at the start again but he's of interest with Billy Loughnane takingover in the saddle.

runners.comment: Promising 3rd here (6f) latest; drops to 5f but no surprise to see him in the thick of it
runners.name: Forever Noah
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden but he has slipped down the weights and his latest third here (6f) was promising, keeping on well in a race that wasn't strongly run; 5f will be a new experience but Daniel Muscutt replaces a 7lb claimer and there could be more to come.

runners.comment: Keeping on over 5f in three runs for new stable this winter; each-way claims
runners.name: Nad Alshiba Snow
runners.spotlight: Exposed 14-race maiden who has been keeping on at the finish in three 5f runs for this yard; should get a good pace to aim at and holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: Course winner (6f); running okay of late without suggesting he was the answer back in trip
runners.name: Rogue Thunder
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a 6f win here; running respectably here this winter without suggesting he was the answer now dropped in trip.

18:00.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: C&D winner who arrives in good form; drawn widest but should go well once more
runners.name: Bluebells Boy
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who arrives in good form, most recently finishing a close third at Chelmsford on Thursday; drawn widest but set to be involved once again.

runners.comment: Went close when gambled on at Newcastle last month; less good last time; headgear change
runners.name: Desert Champion
runners.spotlight: Tumbled down the weights and was well supported at Newcastle last month, making the running but headed inside the final furlong; failed to back it up one week later;  blinkers replace visor today.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't had him along and he's run well for a long way on his first two outings for us. The handicapper put him up 10lb when he won at Chelmsford and that was probably his undoing, but he also hasn't run to that form since. The jury is out as to whether he's a horse for the all-weather as opposed to the turf. 14-08-25

runners.comment: Infrequent winner but usually gives his running; each-way claims at least
runners.name: Papa Dont Preach

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Frost Racing Club & David Orr

runners.spotlight: Reliable sprinter but he finds winning difficult, successful just once since January 2023; likely to be involved but others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: Made all over C&D three weeks ago; up 4lb and other pace to deal with
runners.name: Street Life
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Apprentice Training Series Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I let Street Life bowl along and as soon as I asked him, he just took off. Last time I rode him, he missed the break and it was game over. He was a lot more relaxed in the stalls - Morgan Cole, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Handicap
quotes.quote: He has done it well. STREET LIFE was away really well and jumped the best of them. He travelled as well, whereas before he was always lazy in his racing. He put it to bed well - Sean Davis, jockey

runners.spotlight: He had been running well in defeat prior to his front-running C&D win three weeks ago; 4lb higher mark asks a stiffer question and there are other pace influences in this field.

runners.comment: Two fair runs for new yard but he needs to raise his game a notch to win
runners.name: Stash The Cash
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris

prev_owners.owner: Hp Racing Stash The Cash & Ptr

runners.spotlight: Both runs for new stable have been respectable but he finished behind Colors Of Freedom last week and may do so again.

stable_tour.quote: He had a few little issues and was very hard to train last year, and he got himself handicapped because of that. But we've been really pleased with him this year and he won well at Catterick first time. 23-04-24

runners.comment: Struggled in two runs for new yard; accessories left off; opposable despite weights drop
runners.name: Isla Bella
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten in two 6f runs for new stable; down in the weights but plenty to prove back at 5f; accessories left off today.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit, on a fair mark and ran well at Lingfield last week; contender
runners.name: Colors Of Freedom

quotes.race: talkSPORT Download The App Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Colours of Freedom has taken a little while to come to hand and I think that stiffer 6f has really played to her strengths. She's off a basement mark, so hopefully she can have a productive winter - Luke Morris, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit and she is 2lb lower than for her C&D win in June; ran well at Lingfield last week given she had to do a lot of running early to lead from a wide draw; one to consider.

runners.comment: Not at her best of late and dropping back to 5f isn't enough to tempt
runners.name: Coast
runners.spotlight: Not at her best of late and dropping back to 5f isn't enough to tempt.

18:30.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Well-beaten 50-1 shot on stable debut in January; down in class; betting to guide
runners.name: Cancelled
runners.spotlight: Had some useful form in Ireland in 2024; well beaten in a Class 2 fillies' handicap (1m2f) at Lingfield on her stable debut in January (50-1); dropped 4lb during her absence and worth a market check.

stable_tour.quote: She had some decent form on the Flat in Ireland and has more to offer in that sphere, but she's jumped well at home, so we've got options with her. She's probably one for the spring, and undoubtedly a nice dual-purpose prospect. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Step back up to 1m2f saw her win comfortably 18 days ago; respected up 4lb
runners.name: Lady Of Arabia
runners.spotlight: Had been running well at around a mile but a step back up in trip and a change of headgear saw her run out a ready winner at Chelmsford 18 days ago (1m2f); up 4lb but should remain competitive.

stable_tour.quote: She really is a lovely filly who always gives her best. Last season she improved with each of her three outings, culminating in a success over a mile at Kempton in December. This year she has progressed again, so much so she won at Haydock on her penultimate outing over 1m2f. She ran back over the same course and distance last Friday and ran well but faded in the last half furlong, having been tight for room over 2f out. The rain they had beforehand at Haydock was not particularly helpful as she is definitely at her best when the ground rides quick. When we can get her conditions again she will be very competitive. 11-07-23

runners.comment: All wins on turf but has AW form; type to bounce back from poor Kempton run 19 days ago
runners.name: Post Rider

quotes.race: Charge Up Your Summer With Rhino.Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Post Rider did it well last time out, and today from a wide draw she bounced out really quickly and I was quite happy to get a lead. She's still learning  - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; gained her third turf win when making all at Newmarket (1m, good) in October; not so good at Kempton 19 days ago but better than that and she should have a big run in her.

runners.comment: Conditions no problem but she was well beaten on Thursday and steps up in class today
runners.name: Renesmee

prev_owners.owner: Roberto Favarulo & King For A Day

runners.spotlight: C&D winner last October; she has added three more wins this year, the latest a wide-margin success at Chelmsford last month; well beaten at Southwell on Thursday off her revised mark and this is a step up in class.

runners.comment: Ran okay on recent stable debut (1m4f); drops in trip and lurks on a dangerous mark
runners.name: Loving Look
runners.spotlight: Two wins (1m4f and 1m2f) for Hughie Morrison last year; 0-7 in 2025, including her stable debut at Newcastle three weeks ago (1m4f); that run wasn't so bad as the bare figures might indicate and she's not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: She's been very consistent, winning twice and being placed on six occasions. She couldn't put one foot in front of another at two and, although she has done well, she still looks as if she'll be a better five-year-old. She just lacks a gear when required. She looks and travels well before just struggling to find that next gear. She definitely stays and was third first time out at Southwell, and then eighth on Friday over 1m4f at Goodwood, where the track possibly didn't suit. 29-05-25

runners.comment: Two 1m4f wins this year; not handicapped out of things if drop in trip proves no hindrance
runners.name: Aiming High
runners.spotlight: Usually races over further, as when winning here and at Lingfield (both 1m4f) this year; not handicapped out of things if the drop in trip doesn't prove an issue.

stable_tour.quote: She loves the all-weather and is due to run this week at Kempton on Wednesday. She loves fast ground and accumulates prize-money in her own little way. She's found out as soon as she hits a mark of 80 but while she's in the 70s she's competitive. 04-09-24

runners.comment: Good course record and she arrives on the back of a ready Southwell win (1m4f); key player
runners.name: Caramay
runners.spotlight: Three wins (two over this trip) and two seconds from her nine visits to Wolverhampton; arrives on the back of a smooth win at Southwell (1m4f) ten days ago and that form was given a boost when the runner-up just missed out next time; a 4lb rise shouldn't prevent another good run.

runners.comment: Good record over C&D; third to Lady Of Arabia at Chelmsford last time; each-way claims
runners.name: Bint Al Daar

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Bint Al Daar wasn't travelling that well early doors but she crept into it and I got a lovely split when I needed it. Kevin Phillippart de Foy's horses are in good form and she enjoyed the ground - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Two wins and a second from her four C&D runs; beaten just under 2l when third to Lady Of Arabia at Chelmsford 18 days ago; each-way shout with Warren Fentiman taking off a handy 5lb.

runners.comment: Near miss over 8.6f here last month; up in trip/class today; others appeal more
runners.name: Liv My Life

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.spotlight: Ran her best race for a while when narrowly beaten over 8.6f here four weeks ago; up in trip and class this time; others make more appeal.

19:00.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Long layoff before well on top in a 5-runner Chelmsford novice (1m2f, AW); useful prospect
runners.name: Time Loop
runners.spotlight: Second at Nottingham (1m, heavy) in October 2023; absent for 772 days but led 1f out to finish well on top in a five-runner novice at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last month, looking a useful prospect; one to follow and can continue to make up for lost time.

runners.comment: Winning jumper; significant Flat ability in two Flat turf runs (1m6f/1m4f) this summer
runners.name: Abingworth
runners.spotlight: One win over hurdles and five over fences, the latest in June but he was pulled up last month on latest outing; showed significant Flat ability in two turf runs (1m6f/1m4f) this summer, so has a chance for minor honours in this company if he takes to the AW.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him in May and he won his second start for us over fences at Market Rasen. He's had a break after running on the Flat and he'll be ready to run early next month. He's quite a nice type and hopefully there's more to come with him. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Work to do judged on both starts and his better effort was on debut
runners.name: Ned Broy
runners.spotlight: 200-1 sixth of nine at Newcastle (1m, AW) last month but not so good under a more prominent ride there (7f) two weeks later; work to do on both.

runners.comment: Sixth foal; Sixties Icon half-brother to three winners; market can guide on debut
runners.name: Moonrunner
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; Sixties Icon half-brother to winners Frenzified (9.5f-1m4f including AW/US; RPR 103), Chicago Star (7f; 73) and Topolina (Slovakian 1m1f); dam 1m2f winner (80); market can guide on debut.

runners.comment: Record in bumpers and two AW Flat novices (7f/1m) suggests he is best watched for now
runners.name: Power Quest
runners.spotlight: Debut third in October was the best of his three runs in bumpers (blinkered in all three); heavy defeats in two AW Flat novices (7f/1m) this month suggest he is best watched despite this longer trip.

runners.comment: 11,000gns foal; Ulysses half-sister to 11.4f-1m6f Flat (RPR 74) and a 2m hurdle winner
runners.name: Calypso Bloom
runners.spotlight: 11,000gns foal; fifth foal; Ulysses half-sister to 11.4f-1m6f Flat (including AW; RPR 74) and 2m hurdle winner Percy Prosecco; dam unplaced at 5f-1m1f (52), half-sister to 1m 2yo Listed winner Thanksfortellingme; probably best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Big odds, remote in two Huntingdon bumpers; eyeshield is removed
runners.name: Miss Helena
runners.spotlight: Big odds, remote in two Huntingdon bumpers; eyeshield is removed.

runners.comment: Fair form; bred to stay further than 1m and plenty suggests she should still do better
runners.name: Rastnet
runners.spotlight: Fair form over 1m on Polytrack in October-December on all three starts, beaten a neck at Chelmsford on latest; bred to stay further than that and plenty suggests that she should still do better; big place chance.

runners.comment: 52,000gns yearling by Territories; on debut, probably up against it
runners.name: Sahara Sunset
runners.spotlight: 52,000gns yearling; seventh foal; Territories half-sister to winners Red Roman (6f 2yo; RPR 92), Carausius (1m4f AW; 89) and Foxy Lass (2m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to Group-placed 6f 2yo winner; on debut, probably up against it.

runners.comment: By Sea The Stars; with powerful connections, she needs a close look on debut
runners.name: Sweet Princess
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Sea The Stars half-sister to winners Arabic Legend (Listed-placed 7f 2yo; RPR 101) and Youngest (7f 2yo; 86); dam 7f-1m2f winner (including Canadian Grade 1; 110), sister to 6f 2yo Group 1/1m Listed winner Lumiere; with powerful connections, she needs a close look on debut.

19:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Prolific winner but he failed to fire at Chelmsford 11 days ago; accessories off tonight
runners.name: Love Your Work

quotes.race: Bombardier Golden Beer Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a unique surface so previous form at the course helps a lot. Love Your Work is declared for Friday and as long as he's all right, he'll run again - Tim Fitzgerald, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Adam said go forward. Love Your Work did have a look, he was a bit lairy in front, but the blinkers have done the job for him. I knew I had to put on a strong gallop. My horse will be better the next time and probably even better dropped back to seven furlongs - Robbie Walsh, jockey.

runners.spotlight: The winner of 14 races, the latest a ready 1m2f win at Chelmsford last month; not so good back at Chelmsford (1m) 11 days ago; experiment with accessories quickly aborted; capable of bouncing back.

runners.comment: Lower mark on AW than turf and went close over C&D last month; one to consider
runners.name: Toralou
runners.spotlight: Didn't have to improve to win a 1m maiden at Musselburgh in August; similar form when a close third in a C&D handicap four weeks ago; capable of defying her lower AW mark this winter.

stable_tour.quote: She had a good first run at Haydock last summer in a race that has worked out well. She didn't run afterwards due to a small injury, but she's back in training now and we're looking forward to getting her out. 19-04-24

runners.comment: Below par last time but on the up beforehand & showed promise on AW last year; low mileage
runners.name: Renewable Dream
runners.spotlight: Placed in 1m handicaps on turf in August and September; not so good at Newmarket when last seen 88 days ago but he showed promise on Tapeta as a 2yo and still has low mileage.

runners.comment: 0-13 but several good runs on AW, including last time; each-way shout
runners.name: Joseph
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden but there have been enough good runs on AW to think a similar event could fall his way; creditable second at Newcastle four weeks ago but nudged back up 1lb for that.

runners.comment: Yet to win but latest Chelmsford 3rd was a solid effort; new headgear tried this evening
runners.name: The Sweet Escape
runners.spotlight: Still seeking a first win but he was back to his best when third of nine at Chelmsford 11 days ago (1m); the cheekpieces tried there are now replaced by new blinkers; one to consider.

runners.comment: Well short of his best on last two starts; hopes rest on a change of stable reviving him
runners.name: Coolree
runners.spotlight: All wins on turf but he is fully effective on Tapeta; well short of his best on his last two starts though and a change of stable (same owners) needs to turn things around.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on last winning mark; promising 4th here nine days ago; respected
runners.name: First Greyed
runners.spotlight: Reeled off a Tapeta hat-trick in the spring, with two of the wins coming over C&D; back to form when fourth over C&D nine days ago and a 1lb drop for that effort helps; more appealing than many.

runners.comment: C&D second last month worked out really well and he's since bolted up at Newcastle; solid
runners.name: Francesi

quotes.race: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Part Of RE Series)
quotes.quote: He travelled really well and when I asked Francesi he quickened nicely. I wasn't expecting it, I knew he had a small chance but with it being my first ride I wasn't 100% sure. I started off pony racing and joined Tony's (Carroll) in July. He's a brilliant boss and gives a lot of young riders chances - Myla Coppins, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: The form of his C&D second last month could hardly have worked out better and he made no mistake at Newcastle nine days ago, beating a subsequent winner by over 3l; up 5lb but has to be high on the list.

runners.comment: Should be well treated now but stable have more obvious claims with Francesi
runners.name: Equion
runners.spotlight: He has slipped to a good mark but that is a result of not finding his best form this year; finished behind First Greyed here nine days ago and stable look to hold stronger claims with Francesi.

20:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: 0-15; fourth over C&D on third run for new yard, finishing just 1l behind Damzon and Zooks
runners.name: Tuba
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; maiden after 15 races but fourth of 11 over C&D 16 days ago, on third run for new stable and finishing just 1l behind Damzon and Zooks, showed he can still be competitive.

runners.comment: Only once thereabouts in her eight starts for new yard; had wind surgery since latest
runners.name: Hedonista
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up (on Tapeta at 1m6f/2m) at turn of the year but, despite a major fall in the weights, has only once been thereabouts in her eight starts for new yard; that was over C&D three starts back and she has had wind surgery (her second) since latest, but there have to be doubts.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well from three to four and is a well-handicapped filly over a trip. I'm looking forward to getting going with her and she may go for an apprentice race at Ascot on May 10. 25-04-24

runners.comment: Consistent this year; close third over C&D, short head behind Damzon and 1l ahead of Tuba
runners.name: Zooks
runners.spotlight: Consistent this year, including wins at about 1m6f on AW in February and turf in July; those are her only two wins but her close third of 11 over C&D (never nearer; short head behind Damzon and 1l in front of Tuba) confirmed she is one to take seriously.

runners.comment: AW record now stands at 1-25 and he needs better than he's shown in recent outings
runners.name: Corsican Caper

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Corsican Caper loves this type of ground, so he'll probably keep going through the autumn. He's not hard on himself and hopefully there's a bit of improvement in him. He'll cope with a bigger track as well and anything from a mile-six to two miles will suit him - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.spotlight: All five wins came in 2024, the first on AW but his overall AW record now stands at 1-25 and he needs better than he's shown in recent outings; just held by Zooks and Tuba judged on their C&D clash 16 days ago.

runners.comment: Showed some spark in June but recent results do not augur well
runners.name: Lawmans Blis

prev_owners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing Ltd & Partner

runners.spotlight: Six-time winner (four times here) who showed some spark in June and has dropped down the weights but recent results do not augur well.

runners.comment: Recent C&D second was closest she's come; she got first run on close 3rd Zooks that day
runners.name: Damzon
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden but recent second over C&D at 20-1 was the closest she's come to a win, in front of four of today's rivals; she got first run on Zooks, who closed to a short head at the line, that day but both ran on well and look major players.

runners.comment: Pulled up over hurdles on latest start; the latest of her ten Flat races was in May 2022
runners.name: Hiconic

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hiconic is a hardy filly and stays well, which is key. She's been getting better with each win and we've been schooling her since we claimed her as a 2yo last year. I'm annoyed I didn't enter her at Market Rasen next week but we'll find another opportunity for her and maybe claim off her next time. We'll have a crack at a Listed race down the line as she has nothing to lose - she's been a revelation -  Alex Hales, trainer.

quotes.race: tote Placepot - Your First Bet Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've done a lot of schooling with Hiconic and she's always jumped. I was pleased with the way she did it from the front on her own. We'll have to go somewhere with a double penalty - Alex Hales, trainer.

runners.spotlight: The last of seven hurdle wins was in July 2024; third on penultimate outing stands out a mile among her four runs this May-August (pulled up in first-time cheekpieces on latest) and the latest of her ten Flat races was in May 2022, so it's hard to be confident about her prospects today.

stable_tour.quote: She ran up a string of four straight wins in juvenile hurdles last season as well as finishing second in Listed company. She has started back in her work now and should be ready to run again by the end of February. She needs a trip now, but although a little off a run I like how she is coming on and she can certainly add more wins to her cv. 30-12-21

runners.comment: Consistent at about 2m on turf; didn't get run of the race when trying C&D on latest start
runners.name: Star Of Jupiter
runners.spotlight: Consistent on turf in July-October once upped to 2m/2m1f and didn't get the run of the race when trying C&D on latest outing; wears tongue-tie and cheekpieces for the first time in combination (has tried plenty of headgear); sole win was at Wolverhampton and he again has a shout.

runners.comment: 0-12; third on handicap debut here (9.4f) in January but a major uphill struggle since
runners.name: Mostly Mozart
runners.spotlight: 0-12; third on handicap debut here (9.4f) in January but it's been a major uphill struggle since, including behind four of these rivals 16 days ago when it did not help that he reared and blew the start.

20:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.breeder: Mme Isabelle Mauger & Mr Guy Benachour
runners.comment: Solid front-running effort at Newcastle nine days ago; easier test will suit; contender
runners.name: Dyrholaey
runners.spotlight: Useful on AW and the seller he won at Southwell last month was a good race of its type; only fourth back in handicap company at Newcastle nine days ago (made the running and finished behind Aberama Gold) but this easier track should be more to his liking; should go well again.

runners.comment: Three wins in 2025 and latest Newcastle 2nd another solid run; up 2lb but right in the mix
runners.name: Aberama Gold

quotes.race: William Hill Farewell Flat Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold seems to enjoy those conditions and we're lucky to have got him really. He ended up in Goodwood on this sort of ground, he won at York before that on better ground, but these are his sort of conditions by the looks of it. I don't know if we'll run him again this year. I'm not sure he's up to Listed class. He's a very good sprint handicapper and he's had a great year. I can't imagine he's going into next year well handicapped, but on these conditions, if you handle them it's probably worth a stone. We'll probably look for valuable sprint handicaps on bottomless ground - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Owner Evan Sutherland said Aberama Gold would handle the ground better than most and he was right. It was very straightforward, he travelled well, the last half a furlong felt like a long way but the loose horse might have been a help. I have inherited a very good horse off Keith Dalgleish. It is his third start for me now, I can't take a great deal of credit for him. The Ayr Gold Cup will be a good target and between now and then I am not certain as there is a bit of time. He is not just a mudlark but he probably wouldn't want it rattling fast - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: That was very nice. We've not really done anything with Aberama Gold since he arrived. He ran at Ayr very quickly after coming from Keith's and even now I hardly know the horse yet. He's in the Stewards' Cup next Saturday and if he gets in, why not run? - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold keeps improving and who knows when we will get to the bottom of him. He doesn't do a whole lot when he gets there but he's a nice horse. I always thought a bit of him and he probably just went a bit weak between two and three. He's versatile with ground and track - Shane Gray, jockey.

quotes.race: Shadwell Stallions Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We had been disappointed with Aberama Gold but giving him time and a strong pace at six furlongs has paid off - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won three 6f handicaps this summer, including on Tapeta, and he ran on well for second at Newcastle nine days ago (finished in front of a couple of today's rivals); up 2lb but unlikely to be too far away at this level.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great year in 2023, but not so much last year. He runs himself in and out of form and hopefully this is an 'in' year. If it is, he's well handicapped. He likes dig in the ground and won the Stewards' Cup two years ago on almost unraceable ground. 14-04-25

runners.comment: C&D winner but this year's success has come over 5f; not at best last time; revival needed
runners.name: Lethal Nymph

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Fox

runners.spotlight: Has a C&D win on his record but this year's two victories have come when prominently ridden over 5f; latest effort wasn't his best but wouldn't be handicapped out of it judged on his penultimate third.

stable_tour.quote: He's done really well over the winter and wants quicker ground rather than slower. We'll look at a summer campaign over six furlongs. Ascot suits him really well and hopefully he could be one for the Wokingham. 02-05-23

He ran a solid second in first-time cheekpieces at Pontefract and we thought he'd win at Thirsk but he got a bump there and it's taken him a long time to get over it. He's back galloping now and, with a bit of luck, he should be running soon. 14-08-25

runners.comment: 0-9 this year but on a dangerous mark and building up to something bigger; interesting
runners.name: Fifty Nifty

quotes.race: QuinnBet Second To The Favourite Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C & D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a slight surprise. Fifty Nifty has worked nicely at home but I wasn't expecting him to go away and win like that. He's a really exciting prospect and fingers crossed we can have a lovely time with him this season - Tom Clover, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Last year's two wins for Tom Clover came over further but the drop to 6f didn't look an issue at Kempton 19 days ago, a race where he finished fifth but went through the race like a well-handicapped horse (got tight for room close home); has a big run in him.

stable_tour.quote: He clearly wasn't right at Newmarket last time as he was running with his head in the air. I don't know whether he got his tongue over the bit or something. Sometimes at Newmarket horses just have a bad experience and don't run up to scratch. He wouldn't have blown a candle out afterwards and he's clearly better than that. It's unfortunate it happened but hopefully we can get him back on track and go from there. We'd like to give him a couple of weeks in the paddock and, while we were hoping he'd go to Ascot, that looks unlikely at this stage. It would be nice to get him back to the July course, where he's won. We like him a lot. 14-05-25

runners.comment: Good 2nd here (5f) last week; can pull hard so stepping up to 6f a slight query
runners.name: Accrual

quotes.race: Sporting Family Change Promoting Kindness British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His first run, Accrual didn't really know what he was doing, but today he was much sharper at the gates - Pat Cosgrave, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Capable of throwing in a stinker but he's a capable sprinter on his day and he ran well here over 5f last week, running on well to chase home a thriving winner (eyeshield first time; second run for new connections); runs off the same mark but the step up in trip a slight query (can pull hard).

runners.comment: Easy C&D win in October; good placed efforts on next two starts; below par latest
runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.spotlight: Hold-up sprinter; ran out the easy winner of a C&D handicap in October (Class 5) and solid placed efforts off his revised mark on his next two starts; couldn't land a blow in a Class 3 here two weeks ago; strong pace would suit.

stable_tour.quote: I think he is a very nice colt with a bright future. His work had been encouraging this spring and we started him off over 7f late last month at Yarmouth in what looked a particularly hot maiden, with several of the big yards represented and many trainers liking their charges. He ran a cracker to be third behind New Science, where he was rather green but ran on well. It was the perfect start to his career as he will have learned plenty and mentally handled things well. There are a few 7f maidens around Royal Ascot time later this month and we will pick our spot to make him a winner and take it from there. He runs in the colours of owner Khalifa Dasmal, who is a great man to train for. His patronage is largely thanks to my former guv'nor David Simcock giving him a nod in my direction. David has been a huge help to me in my career and I am very hopeful that I have a potentially nice horse here for Mr Dasmal. 10-06-21

runners.comment: Veteran C&D winner; sharper for recent return from a break but still likely vulnerable
runners.name: Brian The Snail
runners.owner: The Brian The Snail Racing Club

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is an old boy who knows the game. Sometimes he breaks out a bit slow - like he's done today - but he thrives being hung onto and it's paid off - Ryan Kavanagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Handicap
quotes.quote: We got a good tow and Brian The Snail battled all the way to the line. On his day he is very good and proved that tonight - Jack Garrity, jockey

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a horse with a lot of ability, but he only ever does it every now and again. His work at home is better than what he shows in the afternoon, but when he puts his best foot forward he's a nice horse - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Owlerton Greyhound Stadium Sheffield Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail had a wind operation during the winter but his first run back was inconclusive as he didn't handle the track at Epsom. He might get into the Wokingham now - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Westow Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was too bad to be true, Brian The Snail never ran a race - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Anywhere Available Now Handicap
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Brian The Snail is quite chunky so we wanted to get a run into him. I've made no secret, we do like him and there is a race at Ascot on May 3 for three-year-olds for him. We have the Commonwealth Cup in mind - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: catterickbridge.co.uk Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a good horse. I was a bit worried about the trip -  5f on a sharp track like this - but he's done it well. He'll be a sprinter - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Book Your 17th October totepool Package Median Auction Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a grand, laid back horse and it took Tony (Hamilton) a while to pull him up there. He had done everything very easily at home and he had a really good blow so he will come on plenty for that. He is a horse we like a lot and it will be a surprise if he doesn't go on to better things - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Prolific veteran who cam from off the pace to win a C&D handicap in April off 1lb lower; he was returning from a break when finishing behind a couple of these at Newcastle nine days ago; odds-on to blow the start and others appeal more for win purposes.

15:50.race_name: Prix Petite Etoile (Listed Race) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (All-Weather Track) (Polytrack)

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iii
runners.name: Crowns Lady

prev_owners.owner: The Crown Inn Fc Racing Syndicate

stable_tour.quote: She's been great for us, winning twice and being placed. She won very nicely at Catterick the other day and is going to return for a fillies' handicap on July 9. She's versatile and is effective at seven furlongs and a mile. 02-07-25

runners.breeder: Sca Elevage De Tourgeville, Mme H Erculiani & Elevage Des Va
runners.name: Thordis
